payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` â€“ FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` â€“ Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` â€“ Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` â€“ Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` â€“ Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` â€“ Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` â€“ Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` â€“ Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` â€“ Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` â€“ End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` â€“ Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

<user_instructions>

# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` â€“ FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` â€“ Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` â€“ Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` â€“ Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` â€“ Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` â€“ Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` â€“ Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` â€“ Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` â€“ Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` â€“ End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` â€“ Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.


</user_instructions>

Operate autonomously as the WeatherVane super-team. Your goal is to drive the roadmap to completion with world-class engineering, data/ML, product, and design rigor.

Current surprise QA ledger:
- No surprise QA audits recorded yet.

Loop:
1. Read state/roadmap.yaml and choose the highest-priority task(s) not done.
2. Call  to refresh the audit ledger for this session.
3. Run  as a lightweight heartbeat; checkpoint if resource limits appear tight.
4. For each chosen task:
   a. Audit docs/code/tests/design to understand requirements.
   b. Implement the work via fs_read/fs_write/cmd_run (code + tests + docs + design polish). Keep slices small enough to verify quickly.
   c. Run critics_run with ["build","tests","manager_self_check","data_quality","design_system","org_pm","exec_review","health_check","human_sync"] and add allocator/causal/forecast critics when relevant. Use state/critics timestamps/results (including git_sha metadata) to skip suites that have already covered unchanged artifacts this session; rerun when the commit changes or after meaningful edits.
   d. Fix issues. If blocked, log the blocker clearly and mark the task blocked with plan_update.
   e. Record decisions, risks, and next actions via context_write (keep state/context.md <= 1000 words).
   f. Snapshot via context_snapshot.
   g. Update roadmap status with plan_update only after exit criteria are satisfied.
   h. For work expected to run longer than ~5 minutes, queue it with heavy_queue_enqueue (include command/context), monitor via heavy_queue_list, and update status with heavy_queue_update while continuing other work.
5. Prioritise shipping real work over repeated self-review loops while still running critics after meaningful changes land; if nothing changed, move forward instead of re-running the same suites.
6. Approximately once every 100 tasks/messages, deliberately audit a completed roadmap item for hidden gaps or regressions. After each surprise QA, call autopilot_record_audit with task_id/focus/notes and, if issues emerge, open fresh tasks to land fixes before resuming new work.
7. Spread surprise QA audits across different epics/milestones rather than clustering; skip the audit if you already inspected that item in the current session.
8. Repeat on remaining tasks. Stop only when no further progress is possible without human intervention.
Maintain production readiness, enforce ML/causal rigor, polish UX, and communicate like a Staff+/startup leader.
Return JSON summarizing completed tasks, tasks still in progress, blockers, next focus items, and overall notes.

[{"text":"ðŸ“‚ docs/weather/blending.md

```json
{
  "path": "docs/weather/blending.md",
  "content": "# Weather Blending Guide\n\nWeatherVane needs a single, stitch-free timeline of weather metrics that covers both\nhistorical observations and forward-looking forecasts. This guide explains how the\n`WeatherCache` blends Open-Meteo archive data with forecast responses, keeps timezones\nhonest, and exposes the metadata modelling and UX layers rely on.\n\n## Key behaviours\n\n- **Dual-source fetches.** `WeatherCache.ensure_range` now orchestrates two upstream\n  calls when the requested window spans today: the Open-Meteo archive API provides\n  observed history up through \"yesterday\" while the forecast endpoint fills future\ndays. Overlapping days prefer archive observations and drop forecast duplicates.\n- **Timezone alignment.** All requests default to `timezone=auto`. Responses are\n  normalised into four columns: `local_date`, `local_datetime`, `utc_datetime`, and\n  `timezone`. We leverage `zoneinfo` so midnight boundaries always reflect the local\n  clock for each geohash, but we also persist UTC strings for joins with Shopify and\n  ads datasets.\n- **Observation provenance.** Each row carries an `observation_type` flag\n  (`observed`, `forecast`, or `stub` for synthetic fallbacks) plus an `as_of_utc`\n  timestamp documenting when WeatherVane generated the record. Analytics can now\n  separate realised weather from forward-looking signals, and front-end charts can\n  label forecast horizons explicitly.\n- **Contract update.** The daily weather schema (`shared/contracts/weather_daily.schema.json`)\n  was expanded to cover the new timezone and provenance fields while keeping\n  `additionalProperties=false`. Data quality checks (`validate_weather_daily`) enforce\n  the contract before anything hits the lake.\n\n## Usage notes\n\n- The worker pipeline extends each tenant's weather request by\n  `FORECAST_HORIZON_DAYS` (currently seven). Historical modelling still filters to the\n  requested end date, while allocation and UX layers can read the forward span for\n  opportunity cards.\n- Cached payloads store the blended response (`generated_at`, units, timezone, and\n  per-day observation types). Re-fetching a range pulls directly from disk with the\n  same schema, so repeated runs are deterministic and fast.\n- Synthetic fallbacks populate the extended schema, allowing local development without\n  live API credentials.\n\nRefer to `apps/worker/flows/poc_pipeline.py::fetch_weather_data` for an example of the\nblended output feeding downstream joins and telemetry.\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

WeatherConnector\nfrom shared.observability import metrics\n\nDAILY_VARIABLES = [\n    \"temperature_2m_mean\",\n    \"temperature_2m_max\",\n    \"temperature_2m_min\",\n    \"apparent_temperature_mean\",\n    \"relative_humidity_2m_mean\",\n    \"windspeed_10m_max\",\n    \"uv_index_max\",\n    \"precipitation_sum\",\n    \"precipitation_probability_max\",\n    \"snowfall_sum\",\n]\n\nDEFAULT_WEATHER_PARAMS = {\n    \"daily\": \",\".join(DAILY_VARIABLES),\n    \"timezone\": \"auto\",\n}\n\nDAILY_FIELD_MAP = {\n    \"temperature_2m_mean\": \"temp_c\",\n    \"temperature_2m_max\": \"temp_max_c\",\n    \"temperature_2m_min\": \"temp_min_c\",\n    \"apparent_temperature_mean\": \"apparent_temp_c\",\n    \"precipitation_sum\": \"precip_mm\",\n    \"precipitation_probability_max\": \"precip_probability\",\n    \"relative_humidity_2m_mean\": \"humidity_mean\",\n    \"windspeed_10m_max\": \"windspeed_max\",\n    \"uv_index_max\": \"uv_index_max\",\n    \"snowfall_sum\": \"snowfall_mm\",\n}\n\n\ndef make_geocell(lat: float, lon: float, precision: int = 5) -> str:\n    \"\"\"Encode a latitude/longitude pair into a geohash cell.\"\"\"\n\n    return geohash2.encode(lat, lon, precision)\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass WeatherFetchResult:\n    cell: str\n    start: date\n    end: date\n    latitude: float\n    longitude: float\n    frame: pl.DataFrame\n    source: str\n    timezone: str\n\n\nclass WeatherCache:\n    \"\"\"Filesystem-backed cache for weather responses with climatology tracking.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/weather\"),\n        connector: Optional[WeatherConnector] = None,\n        precision: int = 5,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.root = Path(root)\n        self.root.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        self.connector = connector or WeatherConnector(WeatherConfig())\n        self.precision = precision\n\n    def _cell_dir(self, cell: str) -> Path:\n        return self.root / cell\n\n    def _range_path(self, cell: str, start: date, end: date) -> Path:\n        return self._cell_dir(cell) / f\"{start.isoformat()}__{end.isoformat()}.json\"\n\n    async def ensure_range(\n        self,\n        lat: float,\n        lon: float,\n        start: date,\n        end: date,\n        extra_params: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None,\n    ) -> WeatherFetchResult:\n        cell = make_geocell(lat, lon, precision=self.precision)\n        path = self._range_path(cell, start, end)\n        started_at = datetime.utcnow()\n        if path.exists():\n            payload = self._load_json(path)\n            timezone_name = str(payload.get(\"timezone\") or \"UTC\")\n            frame = self._prepare_frame(cell, lat, lon, payload, update_climatology=False)\n            self._emit_fetch_metric(\n                cell=cell,\n                outcome=\"hit\",\n                source=\"cache\",\n                duration_seconds=(datetime.utcnow() - started_at).total_seconds(),\n                row_count=int(frame.height),\n                lat=lat,\n                lon=lon,\n            )\n            return WeatherFetchResult(\n                cell=cell,\n                start=start,\n                end=end,\n                latitude=lat,\n                longitude=lon,\n                frame=frame,\n                source=\"cache\",\n                timezone=timezone_name,\n            )\n\n        params = dict(DEFAULT_WEATHER_PARAMS)\n        if extra_params:\n            params.update(extra_params)\n        try:\n            response = await self._fetch_blended_payload(\n                cell=cell,\n                lat=lat,\n                lon=lon,\n                start=start,\n                end=end,\n                params=params,\n            )\n            self._cell_dir(cell).mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n            self._write_json(path, response)\n            timezone_name = str(response.get(\"timezone\") or params.get(\"timezone\") or \"UTC\")\n            frame = self._prepare_frame(cell, lat, lon, response, update_climatology=True)\n            self._emit_fetch_metric(\n                cell=cell,\n                outcome=\"miss\",\n                source=\"upstream\",\n                duration_seconds=(datetime.utcnow() - started_at).total_seconds(),\n                row_count=int(frame.height),\n                lat=lat,\n                lon=lon,\n            )\n            return WeatherFetchResult(\n                cell=cell,\n                start=start,\n                end=end,\n                latitude=lat,\n                longitude=lon,\n                frame=frame,\n                source=\"upstream\",\n                timezone=timezone_name,\n            )\n        except Exception:\n            self._emit_fetch_metric(\n                cell=cell,\n                outcome=\"error\",\n                source=\"upstream\",\n                duration_seconds=(datetime.utcnow() - started_at).total_seconds(),\n                row_count=None,\n                lat=lat,\n                lon=lon,\n            )\n            raise\n\n    async def _fetch_blended_payload(\n        self,\n        *,\n        cell: str,\n        lat: float,\n        lon: float,\n        start: date,\n        end: date,\n        params: dict[str, Any],\n    ) -> dict[str, Any]:\n        params_with_range = dict(params)\n        params_with_range.update(\n            {\n                \"start_date\": start.isoformat(),\n                \"end_date\": end.isoformat(),\n            }\n        )\n\n        forecast_payload = await self.connector.fetch_forecast(lat=lat, lon=lon, **params_with_range)\n        timezone_value = forecast_payload.get(\"timezone\")\n        timezone_name = (\n            str(timezone_value)\n            if timezone_value not in (None, \"\", \"auto\")\n            else \"UTC\"\n        )\n        utc_offset_seconds = int(forecast_payload.get(\"utc_offset_seconds\") or 0)\n        units = forecast_payload.get(\"daily_units\") or {}\n\n        local_today = self._local_today(timezone_name)\n        historical_end_date = local_today - timedelta(days=1)\n        archive_end = min(end, historical_end_date)\n\n        frames: list[pl.DataFrame] = []\n        archive_payload: dict[str, Any] | None = None\n        if archive_end >= start:\n            archive_params = dict(params)\n            archive_params.update(\n                {\n                    \"start_date\": start.isoformat(),\n                    \"end_date\": archive_end.isoformat(),\n                }\n            )\n            archive_payload = await self.connector.fetch_archive(lat=lat, lon=lon, **archive_params)\n            archive_timezone = archive_payload.get(\"timezone\")\n            if archive_timezone:\n                if timezone_value in (None, \"\", \"auto\") and timezone_name == \"UTC\":\n                    timezone_name = str(archive_timezone)\n                elif archive_timezone != timezone_name:\n                    raise ValueError(\n                        f\"Forecast timezone {timezone_name} does not match archive timezone {archive_timezone}\"\n                    )\n            if not units:\n                units = archive_payload.get(\"daily_units\") or {}\n            if not utc_offset_seconds:\n                utc_offset_seconds = int(archive_payload.get(\"utc_offset_seconds\") or 0)\n\n            archive_frame = self._payload_to_frame(cell, lat, lon, archive_payload)\n            archive_frame = self._filter_frame_range(archive_frame, start, archive_end)\n            if not archive_frame.is_empty():\n                frames.append(\n                    archive_frame.with_columns(\n                        pl.lit(\"observed\").alias(\"observation_type\"),\n                        pl.lit(0).alias(\"__priority\"),\n                    )\n                )\n\n        forecast_start = max(start, local_today)\n        forecast_frame = self._payload_to_frame(cell, lat, lon, forecast_payload)\n        forecast_frame = self._filter_frame_range(forecast_frame, forecast_start, end)\n        if not forecast_frame.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                forecast_frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.lit(\"forecast\").alias(\"observation_type\"),\n                    pl.lit(1).alias(\"__priority\"),\n                )\n            )\n\n        combined = self._combine_frames(frames)\n        return self._frame_to_payload(\n            combined,\n            latitude=lat,\n            longitude=lon,\n            tz_name=timezone_name,\n            utc_offset_seconds=utc_offset_seconds,\n            units=units,\n        )\n\n    def _frame_to_payload(\n        self,\n        frame: pl.DataFrame,\n        *,\n        latitude: float,\n        longitude: float,\n        tz_name: str,\n        utc_offset_seconds: int,\n        units: dict[str, Any],\n    ) -> dict[str, Any]:\n        generated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()\n\n        if frame.is_empty():\n            daily = {\"time\": [], \"observation_type\": []}\n        else:\n            if \"observation_type\" not in frame.columns:\n                frame = frame.with_columns(pl.lit(\"observed\").alias(\"observation_type\"))\n            frame = frame.sort([\"date\", \"geohash\"])\n            dates = frame.get_column(\"date\").to_list()\n            daily = {\n                \"time\": dates,\n                \"observation_type\": frame.get_column(\"observation_type\").to_list(),\n            }\n            for api_field, column_name in DAILY_FIELD_MAP.items():\n                if column_name in frame.columns:\n                    values = frame.get_column(column_name).to_list()\n                    if api_field == \"precipitation_probability_max\":\n                        values = [None if value is None else float(value) * 100 for value in values]\n                    else:\n                        values = [None if value is None else float(value) for value in values]\n                else:\n                    values = [None] * len(dates)\n                daily[api_field] = values\n\n        return {\n            \"latitude\": latitude,\n            \"longitude\": longitude,\n            \"timezone\": tz_name,\n            \"utc_offset_seconds\": utc_offset_seconds,\n            \"daily\": daily,\n            \"daily_units\": units or {},\n            \"generated_at\": generated_at,\n        }\n\n    def _combine_frames(self, frames: list[pl.DataFrame]) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if not frames:\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": []})\n\n        combined = pl.concat(frames, how=\"vertical\")\n        if combined.is_empty():\n            return combined.drop([\"__priority\"], strict=False)\n\n        if \"__priority\" not in combined.columns:\n            combined = combined.with_columns(pl.lit(0).alias(\"__priority\"))\n        if \"observation_type\" not in combined.columns:\n            combined = combined.with_columns(pl.lit(\"observed\").alias(\"observation_type\"))\n\n        combined = combined.sort([\"date\", \"__priority\"])\n        combined = combined.unique([\"date\", \"geohash\"], keep=\"first\")\n        combined = combined.drop([\"__priority\"], strict=False)\n        return combined.sort([\"date\", \"geohash\"])\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _filter_frame_range(frame: pl.DataFrame, start: date, end: date) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if frame.is_empty():\n            return frame\n        if start > end:\n            return frame.head(0)\n        start_str = start.isoformat()\n        end_str = end.isoformat()\n        return frame.filter(pl.col(\"date\").is_between(pl.lit(start_str), pl.lit(end_str)))\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _local_today(timezone_name: str) -> date:\n        try:\n            tz = ZoneInfo(timezone_name)\n        except Exception:\n            return date.today()\n        return datetime.now(tz).date()\n\n\n    def prune(self, max_files_per_cell: int = 12) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Trim cached ranges per cell to avoid unbounded growth.\"\"\"\n\n        limit = max(0, int(max_files_per_cell))\n        for cell_dir in self.root.iterdir():\n            if not cell_dir.is_dir():\n                continue\n            timed_paths: list[tuple[float, Path]] = []\n            for path in cell_dir.glob(\"*.json\"):\n                try:\n                    mtime = path.stat().st_mtime\n                except FileNotFoundError:\n                    continue\n                timed_paths.append((mtime, path))\n            if not timed_paths:\n                continue\n            if limit == 0:\n                stale_entries = timed_paths\n            else:\n                stale_count = len(timed_paths) - limit\n                if stale_count <= 0:\n                    continue\n                stale_entries = heapq.nsmallest(stale_count, timed_paths, key=lambda item: item[0])\n            for _, stale_path in stale_entries:\n                stale_path.unlink(missing_ok=True)\n\n    def _prepare_frame(\n        self,\n        cell: str,\n        lat: float,\n        lon: float,\n        payload: dict[str, Any],\n        *,\n        update_climatology: bool,\n    ) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        frame = self._payload_to_frame(cell, lat, lon, payload)\n        if frame.is_empty():\n            return frame\n\n        climatology = self._load_climatology(cell)\n        frame = self._apply_climatology(frame, climatology)\n\n        if update_climatology:\n            self._update_climatology(cell, frame)\n\n        generated_at = str(payload.get(\"generated_at\") or datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=timezone.utc).isoformat())\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns([\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\").shift(1).over(\"geohash\").alias(\"temp_c_lag1\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\").shift(1).over(\"geohash\").alias(\"precip_mm_lag1\"),\n            pl.col(\"uv_index_max\").shift(1).over(\"geohash\").alias(\"uv_index_lag1\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_probability\").shift(1).over(\"geohash\").alias(\"precip_probability_lag1\"),\n            pl.col(\"humidity_mean\").shift(1).over(\"geohash\").alias(\"humidity_lag1\"),\n            (pl.col(\"temp_c\") <= 0).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"freeze_flag\"),\n            (pl.col(\"temp_c\") >= 30).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"heatwave_flag\"),\n            (pl.col(\"snowfall_mm\") > 0).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"snow_event_flag\"),\n            (pl.col(\"windspeed_max\") >= 50).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"high_wind_flag\"),\n            (pl.col(\"uv_index_max\") >= 7).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"uv_alert_flag\"),\n            (pl.col(\"precip_probability\").fill_null(0.0) >= 0.7).cast(pl.Int8).alias(\"high_precip_prob_flag\"),\n            pl.lit(generated_at).alias(\"as_of_utc\"),\n        ])\n\n        return frame.select([\n            \"date\",\n            \"local_date\",\n            \"local_datetime\",\n            \"utc_datetime\",\n            \"timezone\",\n            \"geohash\",\n            \"day_of_year\",\n            \"temp_c\",\n            \"temp_max_c\",\n            \"temp_min_c\",\n            \"apparent_temp_c\",\n            \"precip_mm\",\n            \"precip_probability\",\n            \"humidity_mean\",\n            \"windspeed_max\",\n            \"uv_index_max\",\n            \"snowfall_mm\",\n            \"temp_anomaly\",\n            \"precip_anomaly\",\n            \"temp_roll7\",\n            \"precip_roll7\",\n            \"temp_c_lag1\",\n            \"precip_mm_lag1\",\n            \"uv_index_lag1\",\n            \"precip_probability_lag1\",\n            \"humidity_lag1\",\n            \"freeze_flag\",\n            \"heatwave_flag\",\n            \"snow_event_flag\",\n            \"high_wind_flag\",\n            \"uv_alert_flag\",\n            \"high_precip_prob_flag\",\n            \"observation_type\",\n            \"as_of_utc\",\n        ])\n\n    def _payload_to_frame(\n        self,\n        cell: str,\n        lat: float,\n        lon: float,\n        payload: dict[str, Any],\n    ) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        daily = payload.get(\"daily\") or {}\n        dates = daily.get(\"time\") or []\n        if not dates:\n            return pl.DataFrame(\n                {\n                    \"date\": [],\n                    \"local_date\": [],\n                    \"local_datetime\": [],\n                    \"utc_datetime\": [],\n                    \"timezone\": [],\n                    \"geohash\": [],\n                    \"day_of_year\": [],\n                    \"temp_c\": [],\n                    \"temp_max_c\": [],\n                    \"temp_min_c\": [],\n                    \"apparent_temp_c\": [],\n                    \"precip_mm\": [],\n                    \"precip_probability\": [],\n                    \"humidity_mean\": [],\n                    \"windspeed_max\": [],\n                    \"uv_index_max\": [],\n                    \"snowfall_mm\": [],\n                    \"observation_type\": [],\n                }\n            )\n\n        length = len(dates)\n        tz_name = payload.get(\"timezone\") or \"UTC\"\n        try:\n            tzinfo = ZoneInfo(tz_name)\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - fallback when timezone database lacks entry\n            tzinfo = timezone.utc\n            tz_name = \"UTC\"\n\n        def series(name: str, default: float | None = None) -> list[float | None]:\n            values = daily.get(name)\n            if not values:\n                return [default] * length\n            return [self._as_float(values[i]) if i < len(values) else default for i in range(length)]\n\n        local_datetimes = [\n            datetime.combine(self._parse_date(raw_date), time.min, tzinfo=tzinfo) for raw_date in dates\n        ]\n        utc_datetimes = [local_dt.astimezone(timezone.utc) for local_dt in local_datetimes]\n\n        precip_probabilities = [\n            (value / 100.0) if value is not None else None for value in series(\"precipitation_probability_max\")\n        ]\n\n        raw_observation = daily.get(\"observation_type\") or []\n        observation_types = [\n            str(raw_observation[i]).lower() if i < len(raw_observation) and raw_observation[i] else \"observed\"\n            for i in range(length)\n        ]\n\n        frame = pl.DataFrame(\n            {\n                \"date\": [dt.date().isoformat() for dt in utc_datetimes],\n                \"local_date\": [dt.date().isoformat() for dt in local_datetimes],\n                \"local_datetime\": [dt.isoformat() for dt in local_datetimes],\n                \"utc_datetime\": [dt.isoformat() for dt in utc_datetimes],\n                \"timezone\": [tz_name] * length,\n                \"geohash\": [cell] * length,\n                \"day_of_year\": [dt.timetuple().tm_yday for dt in local_datetimes],\n                \"temp_c\": series(\"temperature_2m_mean\"),\n                \"temp_max_c\": series(\"temperature_2m_max\"),\n                \"temp_min_c\": series(\"temperature_2m_min\"),\n                \"apparent_temp_c\": series(\"apparent_temperature_mean\"),\n                \"precip_mm\": series(\"precipitation_sum\", default=0.0),\n                \"precip_probability\": precip_probabilities,\n                \"humidity_mean\": series(\"relative_humidity_2m_mean\"),\n                \"windspeed_max\": series(\"windspeed_10m_max\"),\n                \"uv_index_max\": series(\"uv_index_max\"),\n                \"snowfall_mm\": series(\"snowfall_sum\", default=0.0),\n                \"observation_type\": observation_types,\n            }\n        )\n\n        return frame\n\n    def _apply_climatology(self, frame: pl.DataFrame, climatology: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if frame.is_empty():\n            return frame\n\n        temp_default = self._safe_mean(frame[\"temp_c\"], 0.0)\n        precip_default = self._safe_mean(frame[\"precip_mm\"], 0.0)\n\n        if not climatology.is_empty():\n            denom = pl.when(pl.col(\"observations\") == 0).then(1).otherwise(pl.col(\"observations\"))\n            climo_means = climatology.with_columns([\n                (pl.col(\"temp_sum\") / denom).alias(\"temp_climo\"),\n                (pl.col(\"precip_sum\") / denom).alias(\"precip_climo\"),\n            ]).select([\"day_of_year\", \"temp_climo\", \"precip_climo\"])\n            frame = frame.join(climo_means, on=\"day_of_year\", how=\"left\")\n            frame = frame.with_columns([\n                pl.col(\"temp_climo\").fill_null(temp_default).alias(\"temp_climo\"),\n                pl.col(\"precip_climo\").fill_null(precip_default).alias(\"precip_climo\"),\n            ])\n        else:\n            frame = frame.with_columns([\n                pl.lit(temp_default).alias(\"temp_climo\"),\n                pl.lit(precip_default).alias(\"precip_climo\"),\n            ])\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns([\n            (pl.col(\"temp_c\") - pl.col(\"temp_climo\")).alias(\"temp_anomaly\"),\n            (pl.col(\"precip_mm\") - pl.col(\"precip_climo\")).alias(\"precip_anomaly\"),\n        ])\n\n        frame = frame.sort([\"geohash\", \"day_of_year\"])\n        frame = frame.with_columns([\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        ])\n\n        return frame\n\n    def _emit_fetch_metric(\n        self,\n        *,\n        cell: str,\n        outcome: str,\n        source: str,\n        duration_seconds: float,\n        row_count: Optional[int],\n        lat: float,\n        lon: float,\n    ) -> None:\n        payload = {\n            \"cell\": cell,\n            \"duration_seconds\": round(duration_seconds, 3),\n            \"row_count\": int(row_count) if row_count is not None else -1,\n            \"latitude\": round(lat, 5),\n            \"longitude\": round(lon, 5),\n        }\n        metrics.emit(\n            \"weather.cache_fetch\",\n            payload,\n            tags={\n                \"outcome\": outcome,\n                \"source\": source,\n            },\n        )\n\n    def _update_climatology(self, cell: str, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> None:\n        if frame.is_empty():\n            return\n\n        additions = frame.group_by(\"day_of_year\").agg([\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\").sum().alias(\"temp_sum\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\").sum().alias(\"precip_sum\"),\n            pl.len().alias(\"observations\"),\n        ])\n\n        existing = self._load_climatology(cell)\n        if existing.is_empty():\n            updated = additions\n        else:\n            existing = existing.rename({\n                \"temp_sum\": \"temp_sum_existing\",\n                \"precip_sum\": \"precip_sum_existing\",\n                \"observations\": \"observations_existing\",\n            })\n            updated = additions.join(existing, on=\"day_of_year\", how=\"outer\")\n            updated = updated.with_columns([\n                (pl.col(\"temp_sum\").fill_null(0.0) + pl.col(\"temp_sum_existing\").fill_null(0.0)).alias(\"temp_sum\"),\n                (pl.col(\"precip_sum\").fill_null(0.0) + pl.col(\"precip_sum_existing\").fill_null(0.0)).alias(\"precip_sum\"),\n                (pl.col(\"observations\").fill_null(0) + pl.col(\"observations_existing\").fill_null(0)).alias(\"observations\"),\n            ]).select([\"day_of_year\", \"temp_sum\", \"precip_sum\", \"observations\"])\n\n        self._write_climatology(cell, updated)\n\n    def _climatology_path(self, cell: str) -> Path:\n        return self._cell_dir(cell) / \"climatology.parquet\"\n\n    def _load_climatology(self, cell: str) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        path = self._climatology_path(cell)\n        if path.exists():\n            return pl.read_parquet(path)\n        return pl.DataFrame({\n            \"day_of_year\": [],\n            \"temp_sum\": [],\n            \"precip_sum\": [],\n            \"observations\": [],\n        })\n\n    def _write_climatology(self, cell: str, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> None:\n        path = self._climatology_path(cell)\n        path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        frame.write_parquet(path)\n\n    def _parse_date(self, raw: Any) -> date:\n        if isinstance(raw, date):\n            return raw\n        if isinstance(raw, datetime):\n            return raw.date()\n        if not isinstance(raw, str):\n            raise ValueError(\"Unsupported date payload from weather provider\")\n        text = raw.strip()\n        try:\n            return datetime.fromisoformat(text).date()\n        except ValueError:\n            if \"T\" not in text:\n                try:\n                    return datetime.fromisoformat(f\"{text}T00:00:00\").date()\n                except ValueError as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive\n                    raise ValueError(f\"Invalid weather date string: {text}\") from exc\n            raise\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _as_float(value: Any) -> float:\n        if value is None:\n            return 0.0\n        try:\n            return float(value)\n        except (TypeError, ValueError):\n            return 0.0\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _safe_mean(series: pl.Series, fallback: float) -> float:\n        value = series.mean()\n        if value is None:\n            return fallback\n        value = float(value)\n        if value != value:  # NaN check\n            return fallback\n        return value\n\n    def _load_json(self, path: Path) -> dict[str, Any]:\n        import json\n\n        with path.open(\"r\", encoding=\"utf-8\") as fh:\n            return json.load(fh)\n\n    def _write_json(self, path: Path, payload: dict[str, Any]) -> None:\n        import json\n\n        with path.open(\"w\", encoding=\"utf-8\") as fh:\n            json.dump(payload, fh)\n\n\nasync def hydrate_weather_cells(\n    cache: WeatherCache,\n    coordinates: Iterable[tuple[float, float]],\n    start: date,\n    end: date,\n    *,\n    max_concurrency: int = 5,\n) -> list[WeatherFetchResult]:\n    coordinate_list = list(coordinates)\n    if not coordinate_list:\n        return []\n    limit = max(1, max_concurrency)\n    semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(limit)\n\n    async def _bounded_fetch(lat: float, lon: float) -> WeatherFetchResult:\n        async with semaphore:\n            return await cache.ensure_range(lat=lat, lon=lon, start=start, end=end)\n\n    tasks = [asyncio.create_task(_bounded_fetch(lat, lon)) for lat, lon in coordinate_list]\n    try:\n        return await asyncio.gather(*tasks)\n    except Exception:\n        for task in tasks:\n            task.cancel()\n        await asyncio.gather(*tasks, return_exceptions=True)\n        raise\n"
}

{
  "path": "apps/worker/flows/experiment_pipeline.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Generate geo holdout experiments and persist results.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nfrom prefect import flow, get_run_logger, task\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.worker.flows.poc_pipeline import TenantContext, fetch_shopify_data\nfrom apps.validation.incrementality import summarise_experiment\nfrom apps.worker.validation.incrementality import (\n    design_experiment_from_orders,\n    summarise_experiment_from_orders,\n    write_experiment_results,\n)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Load incrementality design\")\ndef load_design(shopify_payload: Dict[str, object], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    return design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Compute experiment summary\")\ndef compute_summary(assigned: Dict[str, object], observations: pl.DataFrame) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    estimate = summarise_experiment(observations, value_column=\"revenue\")\n    return {\n        \"lift\": estimate.lift,\n        \"absolute_lift\": estimate.absolute_lift,\n        \"p_value\": estimate.p_value,\n        \"conf_low\": estimate.conf_low,\n        \"conf_high\": estimate.conf_high,\n        \"treatment_mean\": estimate.treatment_mean,\n        \"control_mean\": estimate.control_mean,\n        \"sample_size_treatment\": estimate.sample_size_treatment,\n        \"sample_size_control\": estimate.sample_size_control,\n    }\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-incrementality\")\nasync def orchestrate_incrementality_flow(tenant_id: str, start_date: datetime | None = None, end_date: datetime | None = None) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=365)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context)\n    design = design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n    payload = {\n        \"design\": design,\n        \"generated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n    }\n    summary = summarise_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, design)\n    if summary is not None:\n        payload[\"summary\"] = summary\n\n    write_experiment_results(tenant_id, payload)\n    logger.info(\"Stored incrementality design for %s\", tenant_id)\n    return {\"design\": design, \"summary\": summary}\n"
}

Dict, List, Optional\n\nfrom prefect import flow, get_run_logger, task\n\nimport polars as pl\n\nimport geohash2  # type: ignore\nimport numpy as np\n\nfrom apps.allocator.heuristics import apps.worker.ingestion.promo import build_promo_ingestor_from_env\nfrom shared.feature_store.weather_cache import WeatherCache, make_geocell\nfrom shared.feature_store.feature_builder import import LakeWriter, read_parquet\nfrom apps.worker.validation.geocoding import evaluate_geocoding_coverage\nfrom shared.validation.schemas import validate_plan_slices\nfrom shared.schemas.base import ConfidenceLevel\nfrom shared.data_context import default_context_service\nfrom apps.validation.incrementality import GeoHoldoutConfig, design_holdout_from_orders\n\nDEFAULT_LOOKBACK_DAYS = 365\nFALLBACK_COORDINATES = [(37.7749, -122.4194)]\nCOORDINATE_LIMIT = 8\nFORECAST_HORIZON_DAYS = 7\n\n\ndef _derive_weather_source(weather_payload: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:\n    sources = weather_payload.get(\"sources\", {}) if isinstance(weather_payload, dict) else {}\n    if sources and all(source == \"stub\" for source in sources.values()):\n        return \"stub\"\n    if sources and any(source == \"stub\" for source in sources.values()):\n        return \"mixed\"\n    if sources:\n        return \"live\"\n    return \"unknown\"\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass TenantContext:\n    tenant_id: str\n    start_date: datetime\n    end_date: datetime\n\n\ndef _decode_geohash(cell: str) -> tuple[float, float] | None:\n    if not cell:\n        return None\n    try:\n        lat, lon, *_ = geohash2.decode_exactly(cell)\n        return float(lat), float(lon)\n    except Exception:\n        return None\n\n\ndef _coordinates_from_orders(shopify_payload: Dict[str, Any] | None) -> list[tuple[float, float]]:\n    if not shopify_payload:\n        return []\n\n    orders_path = shopify_payload.get(\"orders_path\")\n    if not orders_path:\n        return []\n\n    path = Path(orders_path)\n    if not path.exists():\n        return []\n\n    frame = read_parquet(path)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return []\n\n    coords: list[tuple[float, float]] = []\n    if {\"ship_latitude\", \"ship_longitude\"}.issubset(frame.columns):\n        coord_frame = (\n            frame.select([\"ship_latitude\", \"ship_longitude\"])\n            .drop_nulls()\n            .unique()\n            .head(COORDINATE_LIMIT)\n        )\n        coords.extend((float(lat), float(lon)) for lat, lon in coord_frame.iter_rows())\n\n    if len(coords) < COORDINATE_LIMIT and \"ship_geohash\" in frame.columns:\n        geos_needed = COORDINATE_LIMIT - len(coords)\n        geos = (\n            frame.select(\"ship_geohash\")\n            .drop_nulls()\n            .unique()\n            .head(geos_needed)\n            .get_column(\"ship_geohash\")\n            .to_list()\n        )\n        for cell in geos:\n            decoded = _decode_geohash(cell)\n            if decoded:\n                coords.append(decoded)\n                if len(coords) >= COORDINATE_LIMIT:\n                    break\n\n    unique_coords: list[tuple[float, float]] = []\n    seen: set[tuple[float, float]] = set()\n    for lat, lon in coords:\n        key = (round(lat, 4), round(lon, 4))\n        if key in seen:\n            continue\n        seen.add(key)\n        unique_coords.append((lat, lon))\n\n    return unique_coords\n\n\ndef _confidence_from_metrics(metrics: Dict[str, Any]) -> ConfidenceLevel:\n    holdout_r2 = float(metrics.get(\"holdout_r2\") or 0.0)\n    cv_score = float(metrics.get(\"cv_mean\") or 0.0)\n    row_count = float(metrics.get(\"row_count\") or 0.0)\n    mae = float(metrics.get(\"mae\") or 0.0)\n    rmse = float(metrics.get(\"rmse\") or 0.0)\n\n    if row_count >= 365 and holdout_r2 >= 0.6 and cv_score >= 0.2 and rmse <= max(0.4 * mae, mae + 1e-6):\n        return ConfidenceLevel.HIGH\n    if row_count >= 120 and holdout_r2 >= 0.25 and cv_score >= 0.05:\n        return ConfidenceLevel.MEDIUM\n    return ConfidenceLevel.LOW\n\n\ndef _risk_from_metrics(metrics: Dict[str, Any]) -> float:\n    \"\"\"Approximate risk-aversion weight from model diagnostics.\"\"\"\n\n    holdout_r2 = float(metrics.get(\"holdout_r2\") or 0.0)\n    if holdout_r2 >= 0.6:\n        return 0.15\n    if holdout_r2 >= 0.3:\n        return 0.25\n    if holdout_r2 <= 0.05:\n        return 0.5\n    return 0.35\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fetch Shopify data\")\nasync def fetch_shopify_data(context: TenantContext, lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\") -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"Fetch Shopify orders/products when credentials exist, fallback to synthetic snapshot otherwise.\"\"\"\n\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\n        \"Fetching Shopify data for tenant %s between %s and %s\",\n        context.tenant_id,\n        context.start_date.isoformat(),\n        context.end_date.isoformat(),\n    )\n\n    shop_domain = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_SHOP_DOMAIN\")\n    access_token = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_ACCESS_TOKEN\")\n    api_version = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_API_VERSION\", \"2024-04\")\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n\n    if shop_domain and access_token:\n        config = ShopifyConfig(shop_domain=shop_domain, access_token=access_token, api_version=api_version)\n        ingestor = ShopifyIngestor(connector=ShopifyConnector(config), writer=writer)\n        orders_result = await ingestor.ingest_orders(context.tenant_id, context.start_date, context.end_date)\n        products_result = await ingestor.ingest_products(context.tenant_id)\n        return {\n            \"orders_path\": orders_result.path,\n            \"products_path\": products_result.path,\n            \"summary\": {\n                \"orders\": orders_result.row_count,\n                \"products\": products_result.row_count,\n                \"orders_geocoded_ratio\": {\n            \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n            \"order_id\": \"sample-order\",\n            \"created_at\": f\"{context.start_date.isoformat()}T00:00:00Z\",\n            \"ship_geohash\": geohash2.encode(FALLBACK_COORDINATES[0][0], FALLBACK_COORDINATES[0][1], 5),\n            \"ship_latitude\": FALLBACK_COORDINATES[0][0],\n            \"ship_longitude\": FALLBACK_COORDINATES[0][1],\n            \"net_revenue\": 0.0,\n        }\n    ]\n    orders_summary = IngestionSummary(\n        path=str(writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_shopify_orders\", sample_orders)),\n        row_count=len(sample_orders),\n        source=\"stub\",\n    )\n\n    sample_products = [\n        {\n            \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n            \"product_id\": \"sample-product\",\n            \"title\": \"Rain Jacket\",\n            \"category\": \"Outerwear\",\n        }\n    ]\n    products_summary = IngestionSummary(\n        path=str(writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_shopify_products\", sample_products)),\n        row_count=len(sample_products),\n        source=\"stub\",\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"orders_path\": orders_summary.path,\n        \"products_path\": products_summary.path,\n        \"summary\": {\n            \"orders\": orders_summary.row_count,\n            \"products\": products_summary.row_count,\n            \"orders_geocoded_ratio\": orders_summary.metadata.get(\"geocoded_ratio\"),\n        },\n        \"source\": \"stub\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Design geo incrementality experiment\")\nasync def design_geo_incrementality_experiment(\n    shopify_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    context: TenantContext,\n    holdout_ratio: float = 0.25,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    orders_path = (shopify_payload or {}).get(\"orders_path\")\n    if not orders_path:\n        logger.info(\"Skipping incrementality design for %s: no orders data\", context.tenant_id)\n        return {\"status\": \"missing_orders\"}\n\n    path = Path(orders_path)\n    if not path.exists():\n        logger.info(\"Skipping incrementality design for %s: path %s not found\", context.tenant_id, path)\n        return {\"status\": \"missing_orders\"}\n\n    orders = read_parquet(path)\n    config = GeoHoldoutConfig(\n        holdout_ratio=holdout_ratio,\n        min_holdout_units=4,\n        seed=int(context.end_date.strftime(\"%Y%m%d\")),\n    )\n    design = design_holdout_from_orders(orders, config)\n    design[\"tenant_id\"] = context.tenant_id\n    design[\"lookback_days\"] = (context.end_date - context.start_date).days\n    return design\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fetch ads data\")\nasync def fetch_ads_data(context: TenantContext, lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\") -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fetching Meta/Google ads data for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    ingestor = build_ads_ingestor_from_env(lake_root)\n    meta_summary = await ingestor.ingest_meta(context.tenant_id, context.start_date, context.end_date) if ingestor.meta_connector else None\n    google_summary = await ingestor.ingest_google(context.tenant_id, context.start_date, context.end_date) if ingestor.google_connector else None\n\n    if meta_summary or google_summary:\n        return {\n            \"meta_path\": meta_summary.path if meta_summary else None,\n            \"google_path\": google_summary.path if google_summary else None,\n            \"summary\": {\n                \"meta_rows\": meta_summary.row_count if meta_summary else 0,\n                \"google_rows\": google_summary.row_count if google_summary else 0,\n            },\n            \"source\": \"ads_api\",\n        }\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n    sample_meta = [\n        {\n            \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n            \"date\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"channel\": \"meta\",\n            \"spend\": 0.0,\n            \"conversions\": 0,\n        }\n    ]\n    meta_path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_meta_ads\", sample_meta)\n\n    sample_google = [\n        {\n            \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n            \"date\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"channel\": \"google\",\n            \"spend\": 0.0,\n            \"conversions\": 0,\n        }\n    ]\n    google_path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_google_ads\", sample_google)\n\n    return {\n        \"meta_path\": str(meta_path),\n        \"google_path\": str(google_path),\n        \"summary\": {\"meta_rows\": len(sample_meta), \"google_rows\": len(sample_google)},\n        \"source\": \"stub\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fetch promo data\")\nasync def fetch_promo_data(context: TenantContext, lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\") -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fetching Klaviyo promo data for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    ingestor = build_promo_ingestor_from_env(lake_root)\n    summary = await ingestor.ingest_campaigns(context.tenant_id, context.start_date, context.end_date) if ingestor.connector else None\n\n    if summary:\n        return {\n            \"promo_path\": summary.path,\n            \"summary\": {\"campaigns\": summary.row_count},\n            \"source\": \"klaviyo_api\",\n        }\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n    sample_promos = [\n        {\n            \"tenant_id\": context.tenant_id,\n            \"campaign_id\": \"sample-campaign\",\n            \"send_date\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"discount_pct\": 0.0,\n        }\n    ]\n    promo_path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_promos\", sample_promos)\n\n    return {\n        \"promo_path\": str(promo_path),\n        \"summary\": {\"campaigns\": len(sample_promos)},\n        \"source\": \"stub\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fetch weather data\")\nasync def fetch_weather_data(\n    context: TenantContext,\n    shopify_payload: Dict[str, Any] | None = None,\n    cache_root: str = \"storage/lake/weather\",\n    lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\",\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fetching weather anomalies for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    coordinates = _coordinates_from_orders(shopify_payload)\n    if not coordinates:\n        logger.warning(\n            \"No geocoded orders found for tenant %s; falling back to defaults\",\n            context.tenant_id,\n        )\n        coordinates = FALLBACK_COORDINATES\n    else:\n        logger.info(\"Derived %d geocells from orders\", len(coordinates))\n\n    cache = WeatherCache(root=cache_root)\n    start_date = context.start_date.date()\n    end_date = context.end_date.date()\n    target_end_date = end_date + timedelta(days=FORECAST_HORIZON_DAYS)\n\n    rows: list[dict[str, Any]] = []\n    sources: dict[str, Any] = {}\n    for lat, lon in coordinates:\n        try:\n            result = await cache.ensure_range(\n                lat=lat,\n                lon=lon,\n                start=start_date,\n                end=target_end_date,\n            )\n            observed_rows = int(\n                result.frame.filter(pl.col(\"observation_type\") == \"observed\").height\n            )\n            forecast_rows = int(result.frame.height - observed_rows)\n            sources[result.cell] = {\n                \"source\": result.source,\n                \"observed_rows\": observed_rows,\n                \"forecast_rows\": forecast_rows,\n                \"timezone\": result.timezone,\n            }\n            rows.extend(result.frame.to_dicts())\n        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - network or connector failures\n            logger.warning(\n                \"Weather fetch failed for (%s, %s): %s; using synthetic fallback\",\n                lat,\n                lon,\n                exc,\n            )\n            cell = make_geocell(lat, lon)\n            sources[cell] = {\n                \"source\": \"stub\",\n                \"observed_rows\": 0,\n                \"forecast_rows\": 0,\n                \"timezone\": \"UTC\",\n            }\n            days = (target_end_date - start_date).days + 1\n            for offset in range(max(days, 1)):\n                current = start_date + timedelta(days=offset)\n                rows.append(\n                    {\n                        \"date\": current.isoformat(),\n                        \"local_date\": current.isoformat(),\n                        \"local_datetime\": f\"{current.isoformat()}T00:00:00+00:00\",\n                        \"utc_datetime\": f\"{current.isoformat()}T00:00:00+00:00\",\n                        \"timezone\": \"UTC\",\n                        \"geohash\": cell,\n                        \"day_of_year\": current.timetuple().tm_yday,\n                        \"temp_c\": 15.0,\n                        \"temp_max_c\": 16.0,\n                        \"temp_min_c\": 14.0,\n                        \"apparent_temp_c\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_mm\": 0.5,\n                        \"precip_probability\": 0.2,\n                        \"humidity_mean\": 0.5,\n                        \"windspeed_max\": 10.0,\n                        \"uv_index_max\": 3.0,\n                        \"snowfall_mm\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"precip_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_roll7\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_roll7\": 0.5,\n                        \"temp_c_lag1\": None,\n                        \"precip_mm_lag1\": None,\n                        \"uv_index_lag1\": None,\n                        \"precip_probability_lag1\": None,\n                        \"humidity_lag1\": None,\n                        \"freeze_flag\": 0,\n                        \"heatwave_flag\": 0,\n                        \"snow_event_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_wind_flag\": 0,\n                        \"uv_alert_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_precip_prob_flag\": 0,\n                        \"observation_type\": \"observed\" if current <= end_date else \"forecast\",\n                        \"as_of_utc\": datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=timezone.utc).isoformat(),\n                    }\n                )\n\n    if rows:\n        df = pl.DataFrame(rows).unique(subset=[\"date\", \"geohash\", \"observation_type\"])\n        df = df.sort([\"date\", \"geohash\", \"observation_type\"])\n        rows = df.to_dicts()\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n    path = writer.write_records(f\"{context.tenant_id}_weather_daily\", rows)\n    return {\n        \"weather_path\": str(path),\n        \"rows\": rows,\n        \"cells\": list(sources.keys()),\n        \"sources\": sources,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Build feature matrix\")\nasync def build_feature_matrix(\n    shopify_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    ads_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    promo_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    weather_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    context: TenantContext,\n    lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\",\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Building feature matrix for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n    builder = FeatureBuilder(lake_root=lake_root)\n    guardrail_status = \"clean\"\n    guardrail_notes: Dict[str, Any] = {}\n    try:\n        matrix = builder.build(context.tenant_id, context.start_date, context.end_date)\n    except FeatureLeakageError as exc:\n        guardrail_status = \"sanitized\"\n        guardrail_notes = {\n            \"message\": str(exc),\n            \"removed_rows\": exc.leakage_rows,\n            \"remediation\": \"dropped_leakage_rows\",\n            \"forward_trigger_dates\": exc.forward_dates,\n            \"forecast_trigger_dates\": exc.forecast_dates,\n        }\n        matrix = exc.matrix\n        if matrix is None:\n            raise\n        logger.warning(\n            \"Feature leakage guardrail triggered for tenant %s; sanitized %d rows\",\n            context.tenant_id,\n            exc.leakage_rows,\n        )\n\n    # Record dataset profiles for downstream context tagging.\n    default_context_service.reset(context.tenant_id)\n    for profile in matrix.profiles.values():\n        default_context_service.record_profile(context.tenant_id, profile)\n\n    return {\n        \"design_matrix\": matrix.frame.to_dict(as_series=False),\n        \"observed_design_matrix\": matrix.observed_frame.to_dict(as_series=False),\n        \"metadata\": {\n            \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            \"orders_rows\": matrix.orders_rows,\n            \"ads_rows\": matrix.ads_rows,\n            \"promo_rows\": matrix.promo_rows,\n            \"weather_rows\": matrix.weather_rows,\n            \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n            \"latest_observed_target_date\": matrix.latest_observed_date,\n            \"leakage_guardrail\": {\n                \"target_available_column\": \"target_available\",\n                \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n                \"total_rows\": int(matrix.frame.height),\n                \"leakage_risk_rows\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows,\n                \"leakage_risk_dates\": matrix.leakage_risk_dates,\n                \"forward_leakage_rows\": matrix.forward_leakage_rows,\n                \"forward_leakage_dates\": matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                \"forecast_leakage_rows\": matrix.forecast_leakage_rows,\n                \"forecast_leakage_dates\": matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                \"passes\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows == 0,\n                \"status\": guardrail_status,\n                **guardrail_notes,\n            },\n            \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"weather_row_count\": len(weather_payload.get(\"rows\", [])),\n        },\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fit models\")\nasync def fit_models(feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fitting baseline + MMM models for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    observed_matrix_dict = feature_payload.get(\"observed_design_matrix\")\n    matrix_dict = observed_matrix_dict if observed_matrix_dict is not None else (feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {})\n    bundle = train_poc_models(matrix_dict)\n\n    return {\n        \"models\": {\n            \"baseline\": {\n                \"coefficients\": bundle.baseline.coefficients,\n                \"intercept\": bundle.baseline.intercept,\n                \"features\": bundle.baseline.features,\n            },\n            \"mmm\": {\n                \"base_roas\": bundle.mmm.base_roas,\n                \"elasticity\": bundle.mmm.elasticity,\n                \"mean_roas\": bundle.mmm.mean_roas,\n                \"mean_spend\": bundle.mmm.mean_spend,\n                \"features\": bundle.mmm.features,\n            },\n            \"timeseries\": {\n                \"features\": bundle.timeseries.features if bundle.timeseries else [],\n                \"target\": bundle.timeseries.target if bundle.timeseries else \"net_revenue\",\n                \"holdout_r2\": bundle.timeseries.holdout_r2 if bundle.timeseries else 0.0,\n                \"cv_scores\": bundle.timeseries.cv_scores if bundle.timeseries else [],\n            },\n        },\n        \"metrics\": bundle.diagnostics,\n        \"quantiles\": bundle.quantiles,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Simulate counterfactuals\")\nasync def simulate_counterfactuals(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any], feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Simulating counterfactual allocations for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    frame_dict = feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {}\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(frame_dict)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return {\"cells\": [], \"total_budget\": 0.0, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    latest = frame.tail(1)\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if col.endswith(\"_spend\")]\n    current_spend = {col.replace(\"_spend\", \"\"): float(latest[0, col]) for col in spend_cols}\n    total_budget = sum(current_spend.values())\n\n    mmm_payload = model_payload.get(\"models\", {}).get(\"mmm\", {})\n    mean_roas_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_roas\", {}) or {}\n    mean_spend_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_spend\", {}) or {}\n    elasticity_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"elasticity\", {}) or {}\n    base_roas = float(mmm_payload.get(\"base_roas\", 1.0))\n\n    guardrails = Guardrails(\n        min_spend=0.0,\n        max_spend=max(current_spend.values() or [0.0]) * 1.5 + 1e-6,\n        roas_floor=0.5,\n        learning_cap=0.25,\n    )\n\n    if guardrails.max_spend < guardrails.min_spend:\n        guardrails.max_spend = guardrails.min_spend\n\n    def _roas_for(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        feature = f\"{cell}_spend\"\n        base = float(mean_roas_lookup.get(feature, base_roas))\n        mean_spend_val = float(mean_spend_lookup.get(feature, current_spend.get(cell, 0.0) or guardrails.min_spend or 1.0))\n        elasticity = float(elasticity_lookup.get(feature, 0.0))\n        if mean_spend_val <= 0:\n            return max(base, 0.0)\n        ratio = (spend - mean_spend_val) / max(mean_spend_val, 1e-6)\n        roas = base + elasticity * ratio\n        if not np.isfinite(roas):  # type: ignore[attr-defined]\n            roas = base\n        return max(roas, 0.0)\n\n    roi_curves: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, float]]] = {}\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float] = {}\n\n    for cell, spend in current_spend.items():\n        candidates = {\n            0.0,\n            guardrails.min_spend,\n            guardrails.max_spend,\n            spend,\n            spend * 0.5,\n            spend * 0.75,\n            spend * 1.25,\n            spend * 1.5,\n        }\n        sanitized: List[float] = []\n        for value in candidates:\n            if value < 0:\n                continue\n            capped = min(max(value, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.max_spend)\n            sanitized.append(round(capped, 6))\n        sanitized = sorted(set(sanitized))\n        if not sanitized or sanitized[0] > 0.0:\n            sanitized.insert(0, 0.0)\n\n        curve_points: List[Dict[str, float]] = []\n        for candidate in sanitized:\n            roas = _roas_for(cell, candidate)\n            curve_points.append({\n                \"spend\": candidate,\n                \"roas\": roas,\n                \"revenue\": roas * candidate,\n            })\n        roi_curves[cell] = curve_points\n\n        baseline_spend = spend if spend > 0 else max(guardrails.min_spend, 1.0)\n        expected_roas[cell] = max(_roas_for(cell, baseline_spend), 0.1)\n\n    return {\n        \"cells\": list(current_spend.keys()),\n        \"total_budget\": total_budget,\n        \"current_spend\": current_spend,\n        \"expected_roas\": expected_roas,\n        \"guardrails\": guardrails,\n        \"metrics\": model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {}),\n        \"roi_curves\": roi_curves,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Allocate budgets\")\nasync def allocate_budget(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    simulation_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    context: TenantContext,\n    context_tags: Optional[List[str]] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Optimising budget allocation for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    cells = simulation_payload.get(\"cells\", [])\n    if not cells:\n        return {\"plan\": [], \"guardrails\": {}, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    quantiles = model_payload.get(\"quantiles\", {}).get(\"expected_revenue\", {}) or {}\n    metrics = model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {})\n    allocation = allocate(\n        AllocationInput(\n            cells=cells,\n            total_budget=float(simulation_payload.get(\"total_budget\", 0.0)),\n            current_spend=simulation_payload.get(\"current_spend\", {}),\n            expected_roas=simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {}),\n            roi_curves=simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {}),\n            guardrails=simulation_payload.get(\"guardrails\"),\n            context_tags=context_tags or [],\n            quantile_factors=quantiles,\n            risk_aversion=_risk_from_metrics(metrics),\n        )\n    )\n    confidence = _confidence_from_metrics(metrics)\n    confidence_value = confidence.value\n\n    roi_curves = simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {})\n    expected_roas_lookup = simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {})\n\n    def _interp(points: List[Dict[str, float]], spend: float, key: str) -> float:\n        sorted_points = sorted(points, key=lambda entry: entry.get(\"spend\", 0.0))\n        if not sorted_points:\n            return 0.0\n        if spend <= sorted_points[0][\"spend\"]:\n            first = sorted_points[0]\n            if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            second = sorted_points[1]\n            span = second[\"spend\"] - first[\"spend\"]\n            if span == 0:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            weight = (spend - first[\"spend\"]) / span\n            return float(first.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (second.get(key, 0.0) - first.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        for idx in range(1, len(sorted_points)):\n            prev = sorted_points[idx - 1]\n            curr = sorted_points[idx]\n            if spend <= curr[\"spend\"]:\n                span = curr[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n                if span == 0:\n                    return float(curr.get(key, prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n                weight = (spend - prev[\"spend\"]) / span\n                return float(prev.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (curr.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        last = sorted_points[-1]\n        if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n            return float(last.get(key, 0.0))\n        prev = sorted_points[-2]\n        span = last[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n        slope = (last.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)) / span if span else 0.0\n        return float(last.get(key, 0.0) + slope * (spend - last[\"spend\"]))\n\n    def _revenue_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0) * spend\n        return _interp(points, spend, \"revenue\")\n\n    def _roas_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n        roas = _interp(points, spend, \"roas\")\n        if spend > 0:\n            return max(roas, 0.0)\n        return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n\n    slices = []\n    for cell, spend in allocation.spends.items():\n        revenue_mid = _revenue_from_curve(cell, spend)\n        p50_factor = quantiles.get(\"p50\") or 1.0\n        if p50_factor <= 0:\n            p50_factor = 1.0\n        scale = revenue_mid / p50_factor if p50_factor else revenue_mid\n        revenue_p10 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p10\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        revenue_p50 = max(0.0, p50_factor * scale)\n        revenue_p90 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p90\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        roas_quantiles = {\n            \"p10\": revenue_p10 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p50\": revenue_p50 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p90\": revenue_p90 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n        }\n        slices.append(\n            {\n                \"cell\": cell,\n                \"recommended_spend\": spend,\n                \"expected_revenue\": {\n                    \"p10\": revenue_p10,\n                    \"p50\": revenue_p50,\n                    \"p90\": revenue_p90,\n                },\n                \"expected_roas\": roas_quantiles,\n                \"confidence\": confidence_value,\n                \"assumptions\": [\"Spend change <=25%\", \"ROAS floor 0.5\"],\n                \"rationale\": {\n                    \"primary_driver\": \"Weather & elasticity uplift\",\n                    \"supporting_factors\": [f\"Holdout RÂ²: {metrics.get('holdout_r2', 0.0):.2f}\"],\n                    \"confidence_level\": confidence_value,\n                    \"data_quality\": \"FULL\" if metrics.get('row_count', 0) > 0 else \"DEGRADED\",\n                    \"assumptions\": [\"Quantile scaling\"],\n                    \"risks\": [\"Forecast error\", \"Inventory limits\"],\n                },\n                \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n            }\n        )\n\n    validate_plan_slices(slices)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"confidence\"] = confidence_value\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"mae\"] = float(metrics.get(\"mae\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"rmse\"] = float(metrics.get(\"rmse\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"bias\"] = float(metrics.get(\"bias\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"prediction_std\"] = float(metrics.get(\"prediction_std\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"quantile_width\"] = float(metrics.get(\"quantile_width\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    return {\n        \"plan\": slices,\n        \"guardrails\": allocation.diagnostics,\n        \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Generate PoC report\")\nasync def generate_poc_report(plan_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Rendering PoC report for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n    return {\"report_path\": f\"poc_reports/{context.tenant_id}/latest\"}\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-poc-pipeline\")\nasync def orchestrate_poc_flow(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"Run the end-to-end Plan & Proof pipeline for a tenant in read-only mode.\"\"\"\n\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=DEFAULT_LOOKBACK_DAYS)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n\n    lake_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_LAKE_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/raw\")\n    weather_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_WEATHER_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/weather\")\n\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    ads_payload = await fetch_ads_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    promo_payload = await fetch_promo_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    incrementality_design = await design_geo_incrementality_experiment(shopify_payload, context)\n    weather_payload = await fetch_weather_data(\n        context,\n        shopify_payload,\n        cache_root=weather_root,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n    weather_source = _derive_weather_source(weather_payload)\n    features = await build_feature_matrix(shopify_payload, ads_payload, promo_payload, weather_payload, context, lake_root=lake_root)\n\n    tag_metadata = {\n        \"weather_source\": weather_source,\n        \"dataset_rows\": {\n            \"orders\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"orders_rows\"),\n            \"ads\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"ads_rows\"),\n            \"promos\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"promo_rows\"),\n            \"weather\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"weather_row_count\"),\n        },\n        \"orders_geocoded_ratio\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}).get(\"orders_geocoded_ratio\"),\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n\n    context_tags = default_context_service.derive_tags(context.tenant_id, tag_metadata)\n\n    models = await fit_models(features, context)\n    simulations = await simulate_counterfactuals(models, features, context)\n    plan = await allocate_budget(models, simulations, context, context_tags=context_tags)\n    report = await generate_poc_report(plan, context)\n\n    context_snapshot = default_context_service.snapshot(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        metadata={\n            \"window\": {\n                \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n                \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            },\n            **tag_metadata,\n        },\n    )\n\n    geocoding_validation = evaluate_geocoding_coverage(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"context\": context,\n        \"plan\": plan,\n        \"report\": report,\n        \"data_context\": context_snapshot.to_dict(),\n        \"geocoding_validation\": geocoding_validation.to_dict(),\n        \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"sources\": {\n            \"shopify\": shopify_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"ads\": ads_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"promo\": promo_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"weather\": weather_payload.get(\"source\"),\n        },\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n"
}
