  "content": "\"\"\"Multi-horizon ensemble forecasting utilities.\n\nThe ensemble blends deterministic baselines with leakage-aware time-series models\nand samples calibrated residuals to produce forecast distributions across future\nhorizons. It is designed to operate on the feature matrices produced by\nFeatureBuilder plus weather cache rows, keeping scaffolding environments aligned\nwith production guardrails.\n\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Mapping, MutableMapping, Sequence\nimport json\nimport math\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, fit_baseline_model\nfrom apps.model.ts_training import HOLDOUT_WEEKS, FitResult, fit_timeseries\n\nDEFAULT_HORIZON_DAYS = 7\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Float64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt8,\n}\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ForecastPoint:\n    date: str\n    horizon_days: int\n    prediction: float\n    quantiles: Dict[str, float]\n    components: Dict[str, float]\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        return {\n            \"date\": self.date,\n            \"horizon_days\": self.horizon_days,\n            \"prediction\": self.prediction,\n            \"quantiles\": dict(self.quantiles),\n            \"components\": dict(self.components),\n        }\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass EnsembleResult:\n    forecasts: List[ForecastPoint]\n    metrics: Dict[str, Any]\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, Any]\n\n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        return {\n            \"forecasts\": [forecast.to_dict() for forecast in self.forecasts],\n            \"metrics\": dict(self.metrics),\n            \"diagnostics\": dict(self.diagnostics),\n        }\n\n\ndef run_multi_horizon_ensemble(\n    design_matrix: Mapping[str, Sequence[Any]] | pl.DataFrame,\n    weather_rows: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]] | None = None,\n    *,\n    date_col: str = \"date\",\n    target: str = \"net_revenue\",\n    horizon_days: int = DEFAULT_HORIZON_DAYS,\n    ensemble_size: int = 400,\n    seed: int | None = 42,\n) -> EnsembleResult:\n    \"\"\"Build a leakage-aware forecast ensemble for multiple future horizons.\"\"\"\n    frame = _coerce_frame(design_matrix, date_col=date_col)\n    if frame.is_empty() or target not in frame.columns:\n        return EnsembleResult(forecasts=[], metrics=_empty_metrics(), diagnostics=_empty_diagnostics(frame))\n\n    observed = frame.filter(pl.col(target).is_not_null())\n    if observed.is_empty():\n        return EnsembleResult(forecasts=[], metrics=_empty_metrics(), diagnostics=_empty_diagnostics(frame))\n\n    features = _infer_features(frame, target=target, date_col=date_col)\n    baseline = fit_baseline_model(observed, target=target, features=list(features))\n\n    ts_input = observed.select([date_col] + list(features) + [target])\n    timeseries_result = fit_timeseries(ts_input, date_col, target, features)\n\n    forecast_frame = _extend_with_weather_forecast(\n        frame=observed,\n        full_frame=frame,\n        weather_rows=weather_rows,\n        date_col=date_col,\n        target=target,\n        horizon_days=horizon_days,\n    )\n    if forecast_frame.height <= observed.height:\n        return EnsembleResult(forecasts=[], metrics=_empty_metrics(), diagnostics=_empty_diagnostics(frame))\n\n    component_predictions = _predict_components(\n        baseline=baseline,\n        timeseries_result=timeseries_result,\n        frame=forecast_frame,\n        features=list(features),\n        target=target,\n    )\n\n    weights = _derive_component_weights(component_predictions, observed, target)\n    ensemble_pred = _weighted_sum(component_predictions, weights)\n\n    residuals = _compute_residuals(ensemble_pred[: observed.height], observed[target])\n    if residuals.size == 0:\n        residuals = np.array([0.0])\n\n    rng = np.random.default_rng(seed)\n    forecasts = _build_forecasts(\n        forecast_frame=forecast_frame,\n        observed_count=observed.height,\n        ensemble_pred=ensemble_pred,\n        component_predictions=component_predictions,\n        residuals=residuals,\n        weights=weights,\n        horizon_days=horizon_days,\n        date_col=date_col,\n        rng=rng,\n        ensemble_size=ensemble_size,\n    )\n\n    holdout_metrics = _compute_holdout_metrics(\n        forecast_frame=forecast_frame,\n        observed_rows=observed.height,\n        ensemble_pred=ensemble_pred,\n        target=target,\n        date_col=date_col,\n        timeseries_result=timeseries_result,\n        horizon_days=horizon_days,\n    )\n\n    diagnostics = _build_diagnostics(\n        frame=frame,\n        features=features,\n        baseline=baseline,\n        timeseries_result=timeseries_result,\n        residuals=residuals,\n    )\n\n    metrics = dict(holdout_metrics)\n    metrics[\"component_weights\"] = weights\n    metrics[\"residual_std\"] = float(np.std(residuals))\n    metrics[\"ensemble_size\"] = int(ensemble_size)\n    metrics[\"observed_rows\"] = int(observed.height)\n    metrics[\"forecast_rows\"] = int(forecast_frame.height - observed.height)\n\n    return EnsembleResult(forecasts=forecasts, metrics=metrics, diagnostics=diagnostics)\n\n\ndef save_ensemble_metrics_as_json(result: EnsembleResult | Mapping[str, Any], path: str | Path) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Persist ensemble forecasts/metrics to disk.\"\"\"\n    path_obj = Path(path)\n    path_obj.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n    payload = result.to_dict() if isinstance(result, EnsembleResult) else dict(result)\n    with path_obj.open(\"w\", encoding=\"utf-8\") as handle:\n        json.dump(payload, handle, indent=2, sort_keys=True)\n\n\ndef _coerce_frame(\n    data: Mapping[str, Sequence[Any]] | pl.DataFrame,\n    *,\n    date_col: str,\n) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    if isinstance(data, pl.DataFrame):\n        frame = data.clone()\n    else:\n        frame = pl.DataFrame(data)\n    if date_col not in frame.columns:\n        raise KeyError(f\"Feature matrix missing required date column `{date_col}`\")\n    frame = frame.with_columns(\n        pl.col(date_col).str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(date_col),\n    )\n    return frame.sort(date_col)\n\n\ndef _infer_features(\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    *,\n    target: str,\n    date_col: str,\n) -> List[str]:\n    features: List[str] = []\n    for column in frame.columns:\n        if column in {target, date_col, \"target_available\"}:\n            continue\n        dtype = frame[column].dtype\n        if dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES:\n            features.append(column)\n    return features\n\n\ndef _extend_with_weather_forecast(\n    *,\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    full_frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    weather_rows: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]] | None,\n    date_col: str,\n    target: str,\n    horizon_days: int,\n) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return frame\n\n    latest = frame.sort(date_col).tail(1)\n    latest_row = latest.to_dicts()[0]\n    latest_date = latest_row[date_col]\n    if isinstance(latest_date, str):\n        latest_date = pl.Series([latest_date]).str.strptime(pl.Date).item()\n    if not isinstance(latest_date, (np.datetime64,)):\n        latest_date = np.datetime64(latest_date, \"D\")\n\n    weather_lookup = _build_weather_lookup(weather_rows, date_col)\n    future_rows: List[MutableMapping[str, Any]] = []\n    numeric_columns = [\n        column for column in full_frame.columns if full_frame[column].dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    ]\n\n    for offset in range(1, max(horizon_days, 0) + 1):\n        future_date = latest_date + np.timedelta64(offset, \"D\")\n        future_key = str(np.datetime_as_string(future_date, unit=\"D\"))\n        row: MutableMapping[str, Any] = dict(latest_row)\n        row[date_col] = future_key\n        row[target] = None\n        if \"target_available\" in row:\n            row[\"target_available\"] = False\n        forecast_overrides = weather_lookup.get(future_key, {})\n        for column, value in forecast_overrides.items():\n            if column in row:\n                row[column] = value\n        for column in numeric_columns:\n            if column not in row:\n                row[column] = float(latest[column][0]) if column in latest.columns else 0.0\n        future_rows.append(row)\n\n    combined = pl.concat([full_frame, pl.DataFrame(future_rows)], how=\"align\")\n    return combined.sort(date_col)\n\n\ndef _build_weather_lookup(\n    weather_rows: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]] | None,\n    date_col: str,\n) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]:\n    if not weather_rows:\n        return {}\n    df = pl.DataFrame(weather_rows)\n    if df.is_empty() or date_col not in df.columns:\n        return {}\n    if \"observation_type\" in df.columns:\n        df = df.filter(pl.col(\"observation_type\").str.to_lowercase() == \"forecast\")\n    if df.is_empty():\n        return {}\n    numeric_cols = [\n        column for column in df.columns if df[column].dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    ]\n    if not numeric_cols:\n        return {}\n    aggregated = df.group_by(date_col).agg(\n        [pl.col(column).mean().alias(column) for column in numeric_cols]\n    )\n    lookup: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]] = {}\n    for record in aggregated.to_dicts():\n        key = record.pop(date_col)\n        if isinstance(key, np.datetime64):\n            key = np.datetime_as_string(key, unit=\"D\")\n        lookup[str(key)] = {column: float(value) for column, value in record.items()}\n    return lookup\n\n\ndef _predict_components(\n    *,\n    baseline: BaselineModel,\n    timeseries_result: FitResult,\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    features: Sequence[str],\n    target: str,\n) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:\n    feature_frame = frame.select(features)\n    baseline_series = baseline.predict(feature_frame)\n    baseline_pred = baseline_series.to_numpy().astype(float)\n\n    ts_pred = timeseries_result.model.predict(feature_frame.to_numpy()).astype(float)\n\n    if frame[target].null_count() >= frame.height:\n        observed_avg = 0.0\n    else:\n        observed_avg = float(\n            frame.filter(pl.col(target).is_not_null()).select(pl.col(target)).mean().item()\n        )\n    naive_pred = np.full(frame.height, observed_avg, dtype=float)\n    return {\n        \"baseline\": baseline_pred,\n        \"timeseries\": ts_pred,\n        \"naive_mean\": naive_pred,\n    }\n\n\ndef _derive_component_weights(\n    predictions: Mapping[str, np.ndarray],\n    observed: pl.DataFrame,\n    target: str,\n) -> Dict[str, float]:\n    if observed.is_empty():\n        return {name: 1.0 / len(predictions) for name in predictions}\n\n    target_values = observed[target].to_numpy().astype(float)\n    weights: Dict[str, float] = {}\n    total = 0.0\n    for name, values in predictions.items():\n        if len(values) < observed.height:\n            continue\n        residual = target_values - values[: observed.height]\n        rmse = float(math.sqrt(np.mean(residual**2))) if residual.size else float(\"inf\")\n        if rmse <= 0 or not np.isfinite(rmse):\n            rmse = 1.0\n        weight = 1.0 / rmse\n        weights[name] = weight\n        total += weight\n\n    if not weights or total <= 0:\n        return {name: 1.0 / len(predictions) for name in predictions}\n\n    return {name: weight / total for name, weight in weights.items()}\n\n\ndef _weighted_sum(\n    predictions: Mapping[str, np.ndarray],\n    weights: Mapping[str, float],\n) -> np.ndarray:\n    total = None\n    for name, values in predictions.items():\n        weight = weights.get(name, 0.0)\n        contribution = values * weight\n        total = contribution if total is None else total + contribution\n    if total is None:\n        raise ValueError(\"No predictions available to blend\")\n    return total\n\n\ndef _compute_residuals(\n    predicted: np.ndarray,\n    actual: pl.Series,\n) -> np.ndarray:\n    actual_values = actual.to_numpy().astype(float)\n    count = min(len(predicted), len(actual_values))\n    if count == 0:\n        return np.array([])\n    return actual_values[:count] - predicted[:count]\n\n\ndef _build_forecasts(\n    *,\n    forecast_frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    observed_count: int,\n    ensemble_pred: np.ndarray,\n    component_predictions: Mapping[str, np.ndarray],\n    residuals: np.ndarray,\n    weights: Mapping[str, float],\n    horizon_days: int,\n    date_col: str,\n    rng: np.random.Generator,\n    ensemble_size: int,\n) -> List[ForecastPoint]:\n    future_slice = forecast_frame.slice(observed_count)\n    if future_slice.is_empty():\n        return []\n\n    last_observed_date = forecast_frame[date_col][observed_count - 1]\n    if isinstance(last_observed_date, str):\n        last_observed_date = pl.Series([last_observed_date]).str.strptime(pl.Date).item()\n    if not isinstance(last_observed_date, (np.datetime64,)):\n        last_observed_date = np.datetime64(last_observed_date, \"D\")\n\n    forecasts: List[ForecastPoint] = []\n    max_horizon = max(horizon_days, 1)\n    res_len = residuals.size\n    res_indices = np.arange(res_len)\n\n    for idx, row in enumerate(future_slice.iter_rows(named=True)):\n        prediction = float(ensemble_pred[observed_count + idx])\n        components = {\n            name: float(values[observed_count + idx]) for name, values in component_predictions.items()\n        }\n        date_value = row[date_col]\n        if isinstance(date_value, str):\n            date_value = pl.Series([date_value]).str.strptime(pl.Date).item()\n        if not isinstance(date_value, (np.datetime64,)):\n            date_value = np.datetime64(date_value, \"D\")\n        horizon = int((date_value - last_observed_date) / np.timedelta64(1, \"D\"))\n        horizon = max(1, min(horizon, max_horizon))\n        scale = math.sqrt(max(horizon, 1))\n        sample_idx = rng.choice(res_indices, size=ensemble_size, replace=True)\n        samples = prediction + residuals[sample_idx] * scale\n        quantiles = {\n            \"p10\": float(np.quantile(samples, 0.10)),\n            \"p50\": float(np.quantile(samples, 0.50)),\n            \"p90\": float(np.quantile(samples, 0.90)),\n        }\n        forecasts.append(\n            ForecastPoint(\n                date=str(np.datetime_as_string(date_value, unit=\"D\")),\n                horizon_days=horizon,\n                prediction=prediction,\n                quantiles=quantiles,\n                components=dict(components),\n            )\n        )\n    return forecasts\n\n\ndef _compute_holdout_metrics(\n    *,\n    forecast_frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    observed_rows: int,\n    ensemble_pred: np.ndarray,\n    target: str,\n    date_col: str,\n    timeseries_result: FitResult,\n    horizon_days: int,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    if observed_rows == 0:\n        return _empty_metrics()\n\n    observed = forecast_frame.take(range(observed_rows))\n    max_date = observed[date_col].max()\n    if not isinstance(max_date, (np.datetime64,)):\n        max_date = np.datetime64(max_date, \"D\")\n    cutoff = max_date - np.timedelta64(HOLDOUT_WEEKS * 7, \"D\")\n    train_mask = observed.select(pl.col(date_col) < cutoff)[date_col].to_list()\n    holdout_mask = observed.select(pl.col(date_col) >= cutoff)[date_col].to_list()\n    if not holdout_mask:\n        return {\n            \"overall\": {\n                \"mae\": 0.0,\n                \"rmse\": 0.0,\n                \"mape\": 0.0,\n                \"bias\": 0.0,\n            },\n            \"by_horizon\": {},\n            \"cv_mean\": float(np.mean(timeseries_result.cv_scores) if timeseries_result.cv_scores else 0.0),\n            \"holdout_r2\": float(timeseries_result.holdout_r2),\n            \"holdout_rows\": 0,\n        }\n\n    holdout_mask_indices = [\n        idx\n        for idx, value in enumerate(observed[date_col])\n        if value in holdout_mask\n    ]\n    holdout_pred = ensemble_pred[holdout_mask_indices]\n    holdout_actual = observed[target][holdout_mask_indices].to_numpy().astype(float)\n    residual = holdout_actual - holdout_pred\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residual))) if residual.size else 0.0\n    rmse = float(math.sqrt(np.mean(residual**2))) if residual.size else 0.0\n    with np.errstate(divide=\"ignore\", invalid=\"ignore\"):\n        mape = float(np.mean(np.abs(residual / np.where(holdout_actual == 0, 1.0, holdout_actual)))) if residual.size else 0.0\n    bias = float(np.mean(residual)) if residual.size else 0.0\n\n    train_end_date = cutoff - np.timedelta64(1, \"D\")\n    horizon_metrics: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]] = {}\n    for idx, actual_value in zip(holdout_mask_indices, holdout_actual):\n        date_value = observed[date_col][idx]\n        if not isinstance(date_value, (np.datetime64,)):\n            date_value = np.datetime64(date_value, \"D\")\n        horizon = int((date_value - train_end_date) / np.timedelta64(1, \"D\"))\n        horizon = max(1, min(horizon, horizon_days))\n        key = str(horizon)\n        metrics = horizon_metrics.setdefault(\n            key,\n            {\n                \"count\": 0,\n                \"mae\": 0.0,\n                \"rmse\": 0.0,\n                \"bias\": 0.0,\n            },\n        )\n        diff = actual_value - ensemble_pred[idx]\n        metrics[\"count\"] += 1\n        metrics[\"mae\"] += abs(diff)\n        metrics[\"rmse\"] += diff**2\n        metrics[\"bias\"] += diff\n\n    for key, metrics in horizon_metrics.items():\n        count = max(metrics.pop(\"count\"), 1)\n        metrics[\"mae\"] = float(metrics[\"mae\"] / count)\n        metrics[\"rmse\"] = float(math.sqrt(metrics[\"rmse\"] / count))\n        metrics[\"bias\"] = float(metrics[\"bias\"] / count)\n\n    return {\n        \"overall\": {\n            \"mae\": mae,\n            \"rmse\": rmse,\n            \"mape\": mape,\n            \"bias\": bias,\n        },\n        \"by_horizon\": horizon_metrics,\n        \"cv_mean\": float(np.mean(timeseries_result.cv_scores) if timeseries_result.cv_scores else 0.0),\n        \"holdout_r2\": float(timeseries_result.holdout_r2),\n        \"holdout_rows\": len(holdout_mask_indices),\n    }\n\n\ndef _build_diagnostics(\n    *,\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    features: Iterable[str],\n    baseline: BaselineModel,\n    timeseries_result: FitResult,\n    residuals: np.ndarray,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    return {\n        \"row_count\": int(frame.height),\n        \"feature_columns\": list(features),\n        \"baseline_has_gam\": baseline.gam is not None,\n        \"timeseries_cv_scores\": list(timeseries_result.cv_scores),\n        \"residual_mean\": float(np.mean(residuals)) if residuals.size else 0.0,\n        \"residual_std\": float(np.std(residuals)) if residuals.size else 0.0,\n    }\n\n\ndef _empty_metrics() -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    return {\n        \"overall\": {\n            \"mae\": 0.0,\n            \"rmse\": 0.0,\n            \"mape\": 0.0,\n            \"bias\": 0.0,\n        },\n        \"by_horizon\": {},\n        \"cv_mean\": 0.0,\n        \"holdout_r2\": 0.0,\n        \"holdout_rows\": 0,\n    }\n\n\ndef _empty_diagnostics(frame: pl.DataFrame) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    return {\n        \"row_count\": int(frame.height),\n        \"feature_columns\": [],\n        \"baseline_has_gam\": False,\n        \"timeseries_cv_scores\": [],\n        \"residual_mean\": 0.0,\n        \"residual_std\": 0.0,\n    }\n\n\n__all__ = [\n    \"EnsembleResult\",\n    \"ForecastPoint\",\n    \"run_multi_horizon_ensemble\",\n    \"save_ensemble_metrics_as_json\",\n]\n"
}

{
  "path": "apps/model/pipelines/poc_models.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"High-level modelling pipeline used by the PoC flow.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, fit_baseline_model, evaluate_r2\nfrom apps.model.mmm import MMMModel, fit_mmm_model\nfrom apps.model.ts_training import FitResult, fit_timeseries\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ModelBundle:\n    baseline: BaselineModel\n    mmm: MMMModel\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, float]\n    quantiles: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]\n    timeseries: FitResult | None\n\n\ndef train_poc_models(matrix: Dict[str, list], target: str = \"net_revenue\") -> ModelBundle:\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(matrix)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        empty_model = BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=0.0, features=[], target=target)\n        return ModelBundle(\n            baseline=empty_model,\n            mmm=MMMModel(base_roas=0.0, elasticity={}, mean_roas={}, mean_spend={}, features=[]),\n            diagnostics={\n                \"row_count\": 0.0,\n                \"feature_columns\": 0.0,\n                \"baseline_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"timeseries_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"average_roas\": 0.0,\n                \"cv_mean\": 0.0,\n                \"holdout_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"mae\": 0.0,\n                \"rmse\": 0.0,\n                \"bias\": 0.0,\n                \"prediction_std\": 0.0,\n                \"quantile_width\": 0.0,\n            },\n            quantiles={\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": 1.0, \"p50\": 1.0, \"p90\": 1.0}},\n            timeseries=None,\n        )\n\n    feature_cols = [\n        col\n        for col in frame.columns\n        if col != target and frame[col].dtype in (pl.Float64, pl.Float32, pl.Int64, pl.Int32)\n    ]\n    baseline = fit_baseline_model(frame, target=target, features=feature_cols)\n\n    ts_frame = frame.select([\"date\"] + feature_cols + [target])\n    ts_result = fit_timeseries(ts_frame, \"date\", target, feature_cols)\n    ts_features = frame.select(feature_cols)\n    ts_predictions = ts_result.model.predict(ts_features.to_numpy())\n\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if \"spend\" in col]\n    mmm = fit_mmm_model(frame, spend_cols=spend_cols, revenue_col=target)\n\n    actuals = frame[target].to_numpy()\n    residuals = actuals - ts_predictions\n\n    with np.errstate(divide=\"ignore\", invalid=\"ignore\"):\n        prediction_safe = np.where(np.abs(ts_predictions) < 1e-6, 1.0, ts_predictions)\n        ratio_residuals = residuals / prediction_safe\n    distribution = np.clip(1.0 + ratio_residuals, 0.0, None)\n    q10 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.10))\n    q50 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.50))\n    q90 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.90))\n\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residuals)))\n    rmse = float(np.sqrt(np.mean(residuals ** 2)))\n    bias = float(np.mean(residuals))\n    quantile_width = q90 - q10\n    prediction_std = float(np.std(ts_predictions))\n    timeseries_r2 = float(ts_result.model.score(ts_features.to_numpy(), actuals))\n\n    diagnostics = {\n        \"row_count\": float(frame.height),\n        \"feature_columns\": float(len(feature_cols)),\n        \"baseline_r2\": evaluate_r2(baseline, frame),\n        \"timeseries_r2\": timeseries_r2,\n        \"average_roas\": mmm.base_roas,\n        \"cv_mean\": float(np.mean(ts_result.cv_scores) if ts_result.cv_scores else 0.0),\n        \"holdout_r2\": ts_result.holdout_r2,\n        \"mae\": mae,\n        \"rmse\": rmse,\n        \"bias\": bias,\n        \"prediction_std\": prediction_std,\n        \"quantile_width\": quantile_width,\n    }\n    quantiles = {\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": q10, \"p50\": q50, \"p90\": q90}}\n    return ModelBundle(\n        baseline=baseline,\n        mmm=mmm,\n        diagnostics=diagnostics,\n        quantiles=quantiles,\n        timeseries=ts_result,\n    )\n"
}

```json
{
  "path": "docs/MODELING_ASSESSMENT.md",
  "content": "# WeatherVane Modeling Capability Assessment\n\n**Date:** 2025-10-09\n**Reviewer:** Claude (Sonnet 4.5)\n**Question:** Can the models actually perform the weather-aware budget optimization task?\n\n---\n\n## Executive Summary\n\n**Verdict: Current models are NOT production-ready for causal weather-driven recommendations.**\n\nThe technical architecture is excellent (time-series validation, context warnings, uncertainty propagation), but the **statistical models lack the sophistication to deliver on the core value proposition**: proving that weather causally drives demand and optimizing spend accordingly.\n\n**Critical gaps:**\n1. âŒ **No causal inference** - Correlation â‰  causation (weather might correlate with revenue but not drive it)\n2. âŒ **Weak MMM** - Not true media mix modeling (missing adstock, saturation, carryover)\n3. âŒ **Limited weather features** - Only temp/precip (missing humidity, UV, wind, pollen, air quality)\n4. âŒ **No spatial heterogeneity** - Same model for all geographies (NYC â‰  LA)\n5. âš ï¸ **Quantile validation missing** - p10/p50/p90 never validated for calibration\n6. âš ï¸ **Forecast uncertainty ignored** - 7-day plans but weather forecasts degrade after day 3\n\n**What works:**\n- âœ… Time-series validation rigor (blocked CV, holdout, no leakage)\n- âœ… LightGBM foundation (better than OLS)\n- âœ… Climatology-based anomaly detection\n- âœ… Uncertainty propagation architecture (quantiles flow through stack)\n\n**Bottom line:** You can claim \"weather correlates with revenue\" but **cannot yet claim \"weather drives revenue\" or \"adjust spend accordingly.\"** This requires causal modeling upgrades.\n\n---\n\n## 1. Media Mix Modeling (MMM) Assessment\n\n**File:** `apps/model/mmm.py`\n\n### Current Implementation\n\n```python\n# Line 90-93: \"Elasticity\" is just correlation coefficient\ncov = float(frame.select(pl.cov(pl.col(col), pl.col(revenue_col))).item())\nelasticity_raw = cov / variance if variance else 0.0\n```\n\n**This is NOT media mix modeling.** It's a simple covariance/variance calculation.\n\n### What's Missing\n\nReal MMM requires:\n\n#### 1.1 Adstock / Carryover Effects\n**Problem:** Ads don't impact sales instantly. Someone sees an ad on Monday, buys on Thursday.\n\n**Solution:** Adstock transformation:\n```python\n# Geometric decay: today's effect = current spend + Î± Ã— yesterday's effect\nadstocked_spend[t] = spend[t] + alpha * adstocked_spend[t-1]\n\n# Or distributed lag:\nadstocked_spend[t] = sum(theta[i] * spend[t-i] for i in range(lag_window))\n```\n\n**Impact:** Without adstock, you:\n- Underestimate ad effectiveness (miss delayed conversions)\n- Can't optimize pacing (front-load vs steady spend)\n- Misattribute sales to organic when they're from earlier ads\n\n#### 1.2 Saturation Curves (Diminishing Returns)\n**Problem:** First $1K of spend has higher ROAS than 10th $1K. Linear elasticity assumes constant marginal return.\n\n**Solution:** Hill/Michaelis-Menten saturation:\n```python\n# S-curve: response = K * spend^gamma / (half_sat^gamma + spend^gamma)\nsaturated_response = K * (spend ** gamma) / (half_sat ** gamma + spend ** gamma)\n```\n\n**Impact:** Without saturation:\n- Recommend infinite spend (no diminishing returns modeled)\n- Miss optimal spend point (where marginal ROAS = target)\n- Can't identify wasted spend\n\n#### 1.3 Hierarchical Structure\n**Problem:** Brand ads (awareness) and performance ads (conversion) work differently. Single-level model conflates them.\n\n**Solution:** Hierarchical Bayesian model:\n```\nRevenue ~ f(brand_spend, performance_spend, weather, seasonality)\n  where brand_spend has long carryover (weeks)\n        performance_spend has short carryover (days)\n```\n\n**Impact:** Without hierarchy:\n- Misattribute brand lift to performance\n- Optimize for short-term conversions, harm long-term brand\n- Can't separate \"new customers\" (brand-driven) from \"repeat buyers\" (performance)\n\n#### 1.4 Causal Identification\n**Problem:** Correlation â‰  causation. Weather and revenue might both correlate with holidays/seasons.\n\n**Solution:** Instrumental variables or quasi-experimental design:\n```\n# Example: Use weather forecast errors as instrument\n# (forecast error uncorrelated with actual demand drivers)\nIV_estimate = Cov(revenue, weather_forecast_error) / Cov(actual_weather, weather_forecast_error)\n```\n\n**Impact:** Without causal ID:\n- Can't claim \"weather drove sales\"\n- Recommendations might chase spurious correlations\n- No defensibility in litigation/audits (\"you blamed weather for our losses\")\n\n### Recommendation: Integrate Robyn or LightweightMMM\n\n**Option A: Meta's Robyn** (R package)\n- Includes adstock, saturation, Bayesian priors\n- Multi-objective optimization (sales + efficiency)\n- Prophet for seasonality decomposition\n- Industry-proven (Meta uses internally)\n\n**Option B: Google's LightweightMMM** (Python)\n- Bayesian MMM with adstock + saturation via JAX\n- Integrates with NumPyro for probabilistic programming\n- Faster than Robyn, easier Python integration\n\n**Implementation path:**\n```python\n# apps/model/mmm_v2.py (new file)\nfrom lightweight_mmm import LightweightMMM\n\ndef fit_mmm_v2(data, media_spend_cols, target_col):\n    mmm = LightweightMMM()\n    mmm.fit(\n        media=data[media_spend_cols].to_numpy(),\n        target=data[target_col].to_numpy(),\n        media_prior=geometric_adstock_prior,  # Carryover\n        extra_features=data[['temp_anomaly', 'precip_anomaly']].to_numpy()\n    )\n    return mmm\n\n# Get optimal allocation\noptimal_budget = mmm.optimize_media(\n    total_budget=100_000,\n    target_roas=2.5\n)\n```\n\n**Effort:** 2-3 weeks for integration + validation\n\n---\n\n## 2. Weather Feature Engineering Assessment\n\n**File:** `shared/feature_store/weather_cache.py`\n\n### Current Features (Lines 154-163)\n\n```python\nframe.select([\n    \"date\",\n    \"geohash\",\n    \"temp_c\",              # Raw temperature\n    \"precip_mm\",           # Raw precipitation\n    \"temp_anomaly\",        # vs climatology\n    \"precip_anomaly\",      # vs climatology\n    \"temp_roll7\",          # 7-day rolling average\n    \"precip_roll7\",\n])\n```\n\n**This is minimal.** Only 2 weather variables (temp, precip) with basic transformations.\n\n### What's Missing\n\n#### 2.1 Additional Weather Variables\n**Missing from Open-Meteo API:**\n- `humidity_relative` - High humidity suppresses outdoor activity\n- `windspeed_10m` - Wind chill affects perceived temperature\n- `uv_index` - Drives sunscreen, beach gear demand\n- `cloudcover` - Affects outdoor dining, events\n- `visibility` - Fog/haze impacts traffic, foot traffic\n- `air_quality_index` - Smog alerts suppress outdoor activity\n- `pollen_count` - Allergies drive antihistamine sales\n- `snowfall` / `snow_depth` - Winter sports, heating products\n\n**Solution:** Expand `WeatherConnector` to fetch:\n```python\n# Open-Meteo supports these via hourly/daily params\nparams = {\n    \"hourly\": [\"temperature_2m\", \"precipitation\", \"relative_humidity_2m\", \"windspeed_10m\", \"uv_index\"],\n    \"daily\": [\"temperature_2m_mean\", \"precipitation_sum\", \"uv_index_max\", \"cloudcover_mean\"]\n}\n```\n\n**Impact:** More weather signals â†’ better predictive power, richer stories (\"UV spike drove sunscreen sales +40%\")\n\n#### 2.2 Lagged Weather Features\n**Problem:** Weather affects shopping with delay (see storm forecast â†’ stock up today).\n\n**Solution:** Add lags:\n```python\n# Feature builder adds:\n\"temp_lag1\",  # Yesterday's temp\n\"temp_lag3\",  # 3 days ago\n\"precip_lag7\", # Last week's rain\n\"temp_forecast_3d\",  # 3-day ahead forecast\n```\n\n**Impact:** Capture anticipatory behavior (forecast-driven stockpiling)\n\n#### 2.3 Weather Events (Binary Flags)\n**Problem:** Continuous variables miss thresholds (32Â°F freeze vs 33Â°F matters for ice melt sales).\n\n**Solution:** Derive binary event flags:\n```python\n\"is_heatwave\": temp_c > 35 and temp_anomaly > 5,\n\"is_freeze\": temp_c < 0,\n\"is_heavy_rain\": precip_mm > 25,\n\"is_storm\": windspeed > 50 and precip_mm > 10,\n\"is_perfect_weather\": temp_c in [18, 25] and precip_mm < 1 and cloudcover < 30,\n```\n\n**Impact:** Capture nonlinear effects (sales jump at freeze threshold, not gradually)\n\n#### 2.4 Extreme Weather Duration\n**Problem:** One hot day vs week-long heatwave have different impacts.\n\n**Solution:** Duration features:\n```python\n\"heatwave_days\": consecutive days above threshold,\n\"dry_spell_days\": consecutive days without rain,\n\"cold_snap_days\": consecutive days below freezing,\n```\n\n**Impact:** Better model cumulative effects (day 5 of heatwave has different behavior than day 1)\n\n#### 2.5 Weather Volatility\n**Problem:** Stable weather vs rapid changes affect planning behavior.\n\n**Solution:** Volatility metrics:\n```python\n\"temp_std_7d\": rolling 7-day std deviation of temp,\n\"precip_volatility\": count of rainy days in last 14 days,\n\"temp_swing\": max(temp) - min(temp) over last 7 days,\n```\n\n**Impact:** Capture uncertainty-driven stockpiling behavior\n\n### Recommendation: Phased Weather Feature Expansion\n\n**Phase 1 (Quick wins - 1 week):**\n- Add humidity, windspeed, UV from Open-Meteo\n- Compute lag-1, lag-3, lag-7 for temp/precip\n- Add binary event flags (heatwave, freeze, heavy_rain)\n\n**Phase 2 (External data - 2-3 weeks):**\n- Integrate air quality API (EPA AirNow or IQAir)\n- Pollen API (if relevant vertical: pharmacy, outdoor)\n- Extended forecast (7-14 day) with uncertainty\n\n**Phase 3 (Derived features - 1 week):**\n- Duration metrics (heatwave_days, dry_spell_days)\n- Volatility metrics (temp_std, swing)\n- Interaction terms (temp Ã— humidity = \"feels_like\")\n\n---\n\n## 3. Causal Inference Assessment\n\n**Current Approach:** Correlation-based (LightGBM predicts revenue from weather + spend).\n\n**Problem:** Cannot distinguish:\n- **Causal:** Weather â†’ Demand â†’ Revenue\n- **Spurious:** Season â†’ Weather + Demand â†’ Revenue (both driven by holidays)\n\n### 3.1 Why Causality Matters\n\n**Scenario:** Model predicts \"Revenue increases when temp > 30Â°C\"\n\n**Possible explanations:**\n1. âœ… Heat drives demand for cold drinks (CAUSAL - actionable)\n2. âŒ Summer vacation â†’ high temp AND high sales (SPURIOUS - not actionable)\n3. âŒ July 4th â†’ high temp AND promotions (CONFOUNDED - credit belongs to promo)\n\n**Without causal inference, you can't tell which is true.**\n\n### 3.2 Methods for Causal Identification\n\n#### Option A: Instrumental Variables (IV)\n**Instrument:** Weather **forecast error** (predicted - actual)\n\n**Logic:** Forecast errors are random noise, uncorrelated with true demand drivers (holidays, promos), but correlated with actual weather.\n\n**Estimate:**\n```python\n# 2-Stage Least Squares (2SLS)\n# Stage 1: Actual weather ~ Forecast error + controls\n# Stage 2: Revenue ~ Predicted weather from stage 1\n\nfrom statsmodels.iv import IV2SLS\n\niv_model = IV2SLS(\n    dependent=revenue,\n    exog=[spend, seasonality, promos],  # Controls\n    endog=[actual_weather],              # Endogenous (might be confounded)\n    instruments=[forecast_error]         # Instrument (exogenous noise)\n).fit()\n```\n\n**Pro:** Identifies causal effect of weather on demand\n**Con:** Requires historical forecast data (Open-Meteo doesn't provide forecast archives easily)\n\n#### Option B: Difference-in-Differences (DiD)\n**Design:** Compare geos with weather shocks to geos without.\n\n**Example:**\n- Texas has heatwave week 1 (treatment)\n- California doesn't (control)\n- Compare TX revenue change vs CA revenue change\n\n**Estimate:**\n```python\n# DiD regression\nmodel = smf.ols(\n    'revenue ~ treat * post + geo_fixed_effects + time_fixed_effects',\n    data=panel_data\n).fit()\n\n# treat = 1 if geo in treatment group\n# post = 1 if time period after weather event\n# Coefficient on treat*post = causal weather effect\n```\n\n**Pro:** Simple, intuitive, doesn't need instruments\n**Con:** Requires parallel trends assumption (TX and CA would trend same without weather)\n\n#### Option C: Regression Discontinuity (RD)\n**Design:** Compare outcomes just above vs just below weather threshold.\n\n**Example:**\n- Days with temp = 31Â°C vs 29Â°C (around 30Â°C heatwave threshold)\n- Assume demand is continuous across threshold\n- Any jump = causal heatwave effect\n\n**Estimate:**\n```python\n# Local linear regression around threshold\nfrom statsmodels.regression.quantile_regression import QuantReg\n\nrd_model = smf.ols(\n    'revenue ~ above_threshold + temp_centered + above_threshold:temp_centered',\n    data=data[abs(data.temp_c - 30) < 2]  # Narrow window\n).fit()\n\n# Coefficient on above_threshold = causal jump at threshold\n```\n\n**Pro:** Very credible (clear counterfactual)\n**Con:** Only identifies effect at threshold, not across full range\n\n#### Option D: DoWhy / EconML (Causal ML)\n**Approach:** Use Microsoft's DoWhy + EconML libraries for heterogeneous treatment effects.\n\n**Workflow:**\n```python\nfrom dowhy import CausalModel\nfrom econml.dml import CausalForestDML\n\n# 1. Define causal graph\ncausal_graph = \"\"\"\n    digraph {\n        weather -> revenue;\n        season -> weather;\n        season -> revenue;\n        spend -> revenue;\n    }\n\"\"\"\n\n# 2. Identify causal effect (controlling for confounders)\nmodel = CausalModel(\n    data=df,\n    treatment='temp_anomaly',\n    outcome='revenue',\n    graph=causal_graph\n)\nidentified_estimand = model.identify_effect()\n\n# 3. Estimate heterogeneous effects (per geo, product, etc.)\ncausal_forest = CausalForestDML(\n    model_y=LGBMRegressor(),  # Outcome model\n    model_t=LGBMRegressor(),  # Treatment model\n)\ncausal_forest.fit(\n    Y=df['revenue'],\n    T=df['temp_anomaly'],\n    X=df[['geo', 'product', 'season']],  # Heterogeneity features\n    W=df[['spend', 'promos']]            # Controls\n)\n\n# Get personalized treatment effects\neffects = causal_forest.effect(X_test)  # \"What's the weather effect for THIS geo/product?\"\n```\n\n**Pro:** Handles complex heterogeneity (different weather effects per segment)\n**Con:** Requires careful confounder specification (garbage in â†’ garbage out)\n\n### 3.3 Recommendation: Phased Causal Inference Roadmap\n\n**Phase 1 (Establish baseline - 2 weeks):**\n- Document current correlation-based approach in `docs/CAUSAL_LIMITATIONS.md`\n- Add disclaimer to UI: \"Predicted associations, not proven causal effects\"\n- Implement basic confounding controls (season indicators, day-of-week, holidays)\n\n**Phase 2 (Quick causal upgrade - 3-4 weeks):**\n- Difference-in-Differences using geographic weather shocks\n- Validate with historical data: \"Would DiD have predicted actual sales?\"\n- Surface causal estimates in plan rationale: \"DiD estimate: +12% lift from heatwave (95% CI: [8%, 16%])\"\n\n**Phase 3 (Advanced causal ML - 6-8 weeks):**\n- Integrate DoWhy + EconML for heterogeneous effects\n- Train CausalForest to estimate weather effects per geoÃ—product\n- Build \"causal confidence\" metric: How certain are we this is causal, not spurious?\n\n**Phase 4 (Gold standard - Future):**\n- Run randomized controlled trials (RCTs): Randomly vary spend across geos during weather events\n- A/B test: Geo group A gets weather-aware recommendations, Group B gets baseline\n- Measure incrementality: Did weather-aware group outperform?\n\n---\n\n## 4. Quantile Prediction & Calibration Assessment\n\n**File:** `apps/model/pipelines/poc_models.py` (Lines 65-73)\n\n### Current Approach: Residual Distribution\n\n```python\n# 1. Train point prediction model (LightGBM)\nts_predictions = ts_result.model.predict(ts_features.to_numpy())\n\n# 2. Compute residuals (actual - predicted)\nresiduals = actuals - ts_predictions\n\n# 3. Convert to relative errors\nratio_residuals = residuals / prediction_safe\ndistribution = np.clip(1.0 + ratio_residuals, 0.0, None)\n\n# 4. Take historical quantiles\nq10 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.10))\nq50 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.50))\nq90 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.90))\n```\n\n**This assumes residuals are stationary and i.i.d. (independent, identically distributed).**\n\n### Problems with This Approach\n\n#### 4.1 Non-Stationary Errors\n**Assumption:** Error distribution is constant over time.\n\n**Reality:** Errors might be larger during:\n- New product launches (more uncertainty)\n- Volatile weather periods (forecast errors)\n- Promotional weeks (behavioral shifts)\n\n**Result:** Quantiles computed on full history don't reflect current uncertainty.\n\n**Fix:** Use rolling window for quantile estimation:\n```python\n# Only use last 90 days of residuals\nrecent_residuals = residuals[-90:]\nq10, q50, q90 = np.quantile(recent_residuals, [0.1, 0.5, 0.9])\n```\n\n#### 4.2 Heteroskedasticity (Non-Constant Variance)\n**Assumption:** Error size doesn't depend on predicted value.\n\n**Reality:** Larger predictions have larger errors (variance scales with level).\n\n**Result:** Wide confidence bands for high revenue, narrow for low revenue.\n\n**Fix:** Model variance as function of prediction:\n```python\n# Train separate model for error variance\nvariance_model = LGBMRegressor()\nvariance_model.fit(X, np.abs(residuals))\n\n# Generate prediction-specific quantiles\npredicted_std = variance_model.predict(X_new)\nq10 = prediction - 1.28 * predicted_std  # 1.28 = 10th percentile of normal\nq90 = prediction + 1.28 * predicted_std\n```\n\n#### 4.3 No Calibration Validation\n**Problem:** Never check if quantiles are accurate.\n\n**Test:** Do 80% of actual outcomes fall between p10 and p90?\n\n**Solution:** Calibration monitoring (already proposed in roadmap Phase 0.5):\n```python\n# apps/model/feedback/calibration.py\ndef evaluate_calibration(predictions, actuals):\n    in_range = (actuals >= predictions.p10) & (actuals <= predictions.p90)\n    coverage = in_range.mean()\n\n    # Should be ~0.80; if <0.7 or >0.9, recalibrate\n    return {\n        'coverage_p10_p90': coverage,\n        'sharpness': (predictions.p90 - predictions.p10).mean(),  # Prefer narrow + accurate\n        'miscalibration': abs(coverage - 0.80)\n    }\n```\n\n### Recommendation: Quantile Regression\n\nInstead of residual-based quantiles, **directly model quantiles**:\n\n```python\n# Train 3 models: one for p10, p50, p90\nfrom lightgbm import LGBMRegressor\n\nmodel_p10 = LGBMRegressor(objective='quantile', alpha=0.10)\nmodel_p50 = LGBMRegressor(objective='quantile', alpha=0.50)\nmodel_p90 = LGBMRegressor(objective='quantile', alpha=0.90)\n\nmodel_p10.fit(X_train, y_train)\nmodel_p50.fit(X_train, y_train)\nmodel_p90.fit(X_train, y_train)\n\n# Predictions are quantile-specific\npred_p10 = model_p10.predict(X_new)\npred_p50 = model_p50.predict(X_new)\npred_p90 = model_p90.predict(X_new)\n```\n\n**Advantages:**\n- Quantiles adapt to heteroskedasticity automatically\n- No stationarity assumption needed\n- Guaranteed monotonicity (p10 â‰¤ p50 â‰¤ p90) with post-processing\n\n**Implementation:** 1-2 weeks (swap residual logic for quantile models)\n\n---\n\n## 5. Geographic Heterogeneity Assessment\n\n**Current Approach:** Single global model for all geographies.\n\n**Problem:** Weather effects vary by location:\n- **Phoenix, AZ:** 40Â°C is normal summer â†’ minimal demand impact\n- **Seattle, WA:** 40Â°C is extreme heatwave â†’ AC unit sales spike 500%\n\n### 5.1 Missing: Geographic Embeddings\n\n**Solution:** Learn location-specific parameters.\n\n#### Option A: Fixed Effects (Simple)\n```python\n# Add geo dummy variables\nmodel = LGBMRegressor()\nmodel.fit(\n    X=pd.concat([\n        X_features,\n        pd.get_dummies(geo_column)  # One-hot encode geo\n    ], axis=1),\n    y=revenue\n)\n```\n\n**Pro:** Easy\n**Con:** Doesn't share information across similar geos (Phoenix and Las Vegas should share \"desert\" characteristics)\n\n#### Option B: Hierarchical Model (Better)\n```python\n# Partial pooling: geo-specific effects regularized toward global mean\nimport pymc as pm\n\nwith pm.Model() as hierarchical_model:\n    # Global parameters\n    beta_global = pm.Normal('beta_global', mu=0, sigma=1)\n\n    # Geo-specific deviations\n    sigma_geo = pm.HalfNormal('sigma_geo', sigma=0.5)\n    beta_geo = pm.Normal('beta_geo', mu=beta_global, sigma=sigma_geo, shape=n_geos)\n\n    # Likelihood\n    mu = beta_geo[geo_idx] * weather + ...\n    revenue = pm.Normal('revenue', mu=mu, sigma=sigma, observed=y)\n```\n\n**Pro:** Shares information (small geos borrow strength from large geos)\n**Con:** Slower training (MCMC sampling)\n\n#### Option C: Spatial Model (Best)\n```python\n# Model weather effect as smooth function of latitude/longitude\nfrom sklearn.gaussian_process import GaussianProcessRegressor\n\n# Feature: [lat, lon, temp_anomaly, precip_anomaly, ...]\n# Target: revenue\n\ngp_model = GaussianProcessRegressor(\n    kernel=RBF(length_scale=[1.0, 1.0, 0.5, 0.5])  # Spatial smoothness\n)\ngp_model.fit(geo_features, revenue)\n\n# Predict for new geo (interpolates from nearby geos)\npred = gp_model.predict([[lat_new, lon_new, temp, precip]])\n```\n\n**Pro:** Handles new geos gracefully (interpolates from neighbors)\n**Con:** Computationally expensive for large datasets\n\n### 5.2 Recommendation: Geo-Stratified Models\n\n**Phase 1 (Quick win - 2 weeks):**\n- Cluster geos by climate (K-means on historical weather stats)\n- Train separate model per cluster (e.g., \"desert\", \"coastal\", \"continental\", \"tropical\")\n- Route predictions to appropriate cluster model\n\n**Phase 2 (Advanced - 4-6 weeks):**\n- Hierarchical Bayesian model with partial pooling\n- Estimate geo-specific weather elasticities\n- Surface in UI: \"Heatwave impact in TX: +18% (Phoenix: +8%)\"\n\n---\n\n## 6. Forecast Horizon & Uncertainty Assessment\n\n**Current Approach:** Generate 7-day plans using weather forecasts.\n\n**Problem:** Weather forecast accuracy degrades with horizon:\n- **Day 1-2:** ~90% accurate (temperature within 2Â°C)\n- **Day 3-5:** ~75% accurate (temperature within 4Â°C)\n- **Day 6-7:** ~60% accurate (temperature within 6Â°C)\n- **Day 8+:** Worse than climatology\n\n### 6.1 Missing: Forecast Uncertainty Propagation\n\n**Current:** Treat forecast as ground truth.\n\n**Reality:** Forecast has error distribution:\n```\nForecast: 35Â°C on Day 5\nReality: Normal(35, Ïƒ=4Â°C) â†’ could be 27Â°C (no heatwave) or 43Â°C (extreme)\n```\n\n**Solution:** Monte Carlo sampling:\n```python\n# 1. Sample forecast errors from historical distribution\nforecast_errors = np.random.normal(0, sigma_by_horizon[day], size=1000)\n\n# 2. Generate ensemble predictions\nensemble_weather = forecast_temp + forecast_errors\n\n# 3. Predict revenue for each ensemble member\nensemble_revenue = [model.predict(w) for w in ensemble_weather]\n\n# 4. Aggregate\nrevenue_mean = np.mean(ensemble_revenue)\nrevenue_p10 = np.quantile(ensemble_revenue, 0.10)\nrevenue_p90 = np.quantile(ensemble_revenue, 0.90)\n```\n\n**Impact:** Wider confidence bands for distant days (honest uncertainty)\n\n### 6.2 Missing: Adaptive Planning Horizon\n\n**Current:** Always 7 days.\n\n**Better:** Adjust by forecast quality:\n- High confidence weather (Day 1-3): Tactical recommendations (spend adjustments)\n- Low confidence weather (Day 4-7): Strategic hedges (prepare for scenarios)\n\n**UI:**\n```\nDay 1-3: \"Heatwave confirmed â†’ Increase cold beverage ads 25%\"\nDay 4-7: \"Possible heatwave (60% chance) â†’ Prepare surge budget, monitor forecast\"\n```\n\n### 6.3 Recommendation: Forecast Quality Metadata\n\n**Implementation (1 week):**\n```python\n# shared/schemas/forecast.py\n@dataclass\nclass WeatherForecast:\n    date: date\n    temp_forecast: float\n    precip_forecast: float\n    temp_uncertainty: float      # NEW: Std dev of forecast error\n    precip_uncertainty: float\n    confidence_score: float      # NEW: 0-1 quality score by horizon\n\n# apps/model/ensemble.py\ndef predict_with_forecast_uncertainty(model, forecast):\n    if forecast.confidence_score > 0.8:\n        # High confidence: use point forecast\n        return model.predict(forecast.to_features())\n    else:\n        # Low confidence: ensemble sample\n        samples = [\n            model.predict(perturbed_forecast)\n            for perturbed_forecast in forecast.sample_ensemble(n=100)\n        ]\n        return {\n            'p10': np.quantile(samples, 0.10),\n            'p50': np.median(samples),\n            'p90': np.quantile(samples, 0.90)\n        }\n```\n\n---\n\n## 7. Summary: Technical Debt & Risks\n\n### 7.1 What Could Go Wrong (Risk Register)\n\n| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation Status |\n|------|-----------|--------|-------------------|\n| **Spurious correlation** - Weather correlates with revenue but doesn't cause it | HIGH | CRITICAL | âŒ Not addressed |\n| **Geographic mismatch** - Phoenix model applied to Seattle | MEDIUM | HIGH | âŒ Not addressed |\n| **Forecast degradation** - Day 7 predictions useless | HIGH | MEDIUM | âš ï¸ Partially (7-day window) |\n| **Overfitting to sparse data** - New products have <30 days history | MEDIUM | MEDIUM | âš ï¸ Partially (context warnings) |\n| **Quantile miscalibration** - p90 contains 60% of outcomes, not 90% | MEDIUM | HIGH | âŒ Not validated |\n| **Adstock misattribution** - Credit today's sales to today's ads (miss carryover) | HIGH | HIGH | âŒ Not modeled |\n| **Seasonality confound** - Blame weather for holiday effects | HIGH | CRITICAL | âš ï¸ Partially (day-of-year controls) |\n\n### 7.2 What Works Well (Strengths)\n\n| Strength | Status | Impact |\n|----------|--------|--------|\n| **Time-series validation rigor** - Blocked CV, holdout, no leakage | âœ… Complete | Prevents overfit |\n| **Context-aware degradation** - Warns when data quality poor | âœ… Complete | Builds trust |\n| **LightGBM foundation** - Better than OLS for interactions | âœ… Complete | Captures nonlinearity |\n| **Climatology baseline** - Day-of-year normals for anomalies | âœ… Complete | Seasonal adjustment |\n| **Uncertainty propagation** - Quantiles flow through stack | âœ… Architecture ready | Needs calibration |\n\n---\n\n## 8. Prioritized Modeling Roadmap\n\n### Phase 0 (Critical - Do First) - 4 weeks\n\n**Goal:** Establish causal credibility baseline.\n\n1. **Causal Limitations Documentation** (1 day)\n   - Create `docs/CAUSAL_LIMITATIONS.md` explaining correlation vs causation\n   - Add UI disclaimer: \"Predicted associations based on historical patterns\"\n\n2. **Confounding Controls** (1 week)\n   - Add season indicators, day-of-week, holiday flags to all models\n   - Validate that weather effects persist after controlling for seasonality\n   - Document in model cards: \"Weather effect: +12% controlling for season\"\n\n3. **Quantile Calibration** (1 week)\n   - Implement `apps/model/feedback/calibration.py` per roadmap Phase 0.5\n   - Validate p10-p90 coverage on historical data (target: 80% Â± 10%)\n   - Surface calibration score in UI: \"Model confidence: 83% coverage (good)\"\n\n4. **Forecast Uncertainty** (2 weeks)\n   - Add forecast quality metadata to weather schema\n   - Implement horizon-dependent uncertainty (Ïƒ increases with days ahead)\n   - Widen confidence bands for Day 4-7 predictions\n\n**Exit criteria:** Model limitations documented, quantiles validated, forecast uncertainty honest.\n\n---\n\n### Phase 1 (High Priority - Do Second) - LightGBM is optional during scaffolding; swap in a fallback when missing.\n    from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor\nexcept (ImportError, OSError):  # pragma: no cover - fall back when native lib missing.\n    from sklearn.ensemble import HistGradientBoostingRegressor\n\n    class LGBMRegressor(HistGradientBoostingRegressor):  # type: ignore[misc]\n        \"\"\"Minimal LightGBM lookalike so pipelines continue in constrained envs.\"\"\"\n\n        def __init__(\n            self,\n            objective: str = \"regression\",\n            n_estimators: int = 600,\n            learning_rate: float = 0.05,\n            subsample: float = 0.8,\n            colsample_bytree: float = 0.8,\n            reg_alpha: float = 0.1,\n            reg_lambda: float = 0.1,\n            random_state: int | None = None,\n        ) -> None:\n            max_iter = min(n_estimators, 50)\n            super().__init__(\n                max_iter=max_iter,\n                learning_rate=learning_rate,\n                l2_regularization=reg_lambda,\n                random_state=random_state,\n            )\n            self.objective = objective\n            self.subsample = subsample\n            self.colsample_bytree = colsample_bytree\n            self.reg_alpha = reg_alpha\n            self.reg_lambda = reg_lambda\n            self.n_estimators = max_iter\n            self.learning_rate = learning_rate\n            self.random_state = random_state\n\n        # Align the API surface expected by the pipeline.\n        def fit(self, X, y, categorical_feature=None, verbose=False):  # type: ignore[override]\n            return super().fit(X, y)\n\nGAP_DAYS = 7\nCV_SPLITS = 5\nHOLDOUT_WEEKS = 8\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass FitResult:\n    model: LGBMRegressor\n    cv_scores: List[float]\n    holdout_r2: float\n    features: List[str]\n    target: str\n\n\ndef _ensure_sorted(frame: pl.DataFrame, date_col: str) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    if date_col not in frame.columns:\n        raise KeyError(f\"Date column `{date_col}` not found in feature matrix\")\n    if not bool(frame[date_col].is_sorted()):\n        raise ValueError(\"Feature matrix must be sorted chronologically by date column\")\n    return frame\n\n\ndef fit_timeseries(\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    date_col: str,\n    target: str,\n    features: Sequence[str],\n    categorical: Iterable[str] | None = None,\n    seed: int = 42,\n) -> FitResult:\n    \"\"\"Fit a LightGBM regressor with blocked time-series CV and holdout evaluation.\"\"\"\n\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        raise ValueError(\"Feature matrix is empty; cannot train models\")\n\n    frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(date_col).str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(date_col))\n    frame = _ensure_sorted(frame, date_col)\n    categorical = set(categorical or [])\n\n    feature_matrix = frame.select(features)\n    X_full = feature_matrix.to_numpy()\n    y_full = frame[target].to_numpy()\n\n    # Prepare holdout split (last HOLDOUT_WEEKS weeks).\n    max_date = frame[date_col].max()\n    if not isinstance(max_date, np.datetime64):\n        max_date = np.datetime64(max_date)\n    cutoff = max_date - np.timedelta64(HOLDOUT_WEEKS * 7, \"D\")\n    train = frame.filter(pl.col(date_col) < cutoff)\n    holdout = frame.filter(pl.col(date_col) >= cutoff)\n\n    fallback_mode = train.is_empty() or holdout.is_empty() or train.height < len(features) + 1\n\n    if fallback_mode:\n        return FitResult(\n            model=DummyRegressor(strategy=\"mean\").fit(X_full, y_full),\n            cv_scores=[],\n            holdout_r2=0.0,\n            features=list(features),\n            target=target,\n        )\n\n    model = LGBMRegressor(\n        objective=\"regression\",\n        n_estimators=200,\n        learning_rate=0.05,\n        subsample=0.8,\n        colsample_bytree=0.8,\n        reg_alpha=0.1,\n        reg_lambda=0.1,\n        random_state=seed,\n    )\n\n    X = train.select(features).to_numpy()\n    y = train[target].to_numpy()\n\n    tscv = TimeSeriesSplit(n_splits=min(CV_SPLITS, max(2, train.height // 2)), gap=GAP_DAYS)\n    cv_scores: List[float] = []\n\n    for train_idx, val_idx in tscv.split(X):\n        model.fit(X[train_idx], y[train_idx], categorical_feature=list(categorical), verbose=False)\n        cv_scores.append(float(model.score(X[val_idx], y[val_idx])))\n\n    model.fit(X, y, categorical_feature=list(categorical), verbose=False)\n\n    X_holdout = holdout.select(features).to_numpy()\n    y_holdout = holdout[target].to_numpy()\n    holdout_r2 = float(model.score(X_holdout, y_holdout)) if len(y_holdout) else 0.0\n\n    return FitResult(\n        model=model,\n        cv_scores=cv_scores,\n        holdout_r2=holdout_r2,\n        features=list(features),\n        target=target,\n    )\n"
}

timedelta\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Iterable\n\nimport geohash2  # type: ignore\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass WeatherShock:\n    start_day: int\n    end_day: int\n    temp_delta: float = 0.0\n    rain_mm: float = 0.0\n\n    def applies(self, day_index: int) -> bool:\n        return self.start_day <= day_index <= self.end_day\n\n\nDEFAULT_GEOS = [(37.7749, -122.4194), (40.7128, -74.0060)]\n\n\ndef seed_synthetic_tenant(\n    lake_root: Path | str,\n    tenant_id: str,\n    days: int = 7,\n    geos: Iterable[tuple[float, float]] | None = None,\n    shocks: Iterable[WeatherShock] | None = None,\n) -> None:\n    geos = list(geos or DEFAULT_GEOS)\n    shocks = list(shocks or [])\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n    today = datetime(2024, 1, 7)\n\n    orders_rows = []\n    ads_meta_rows = []\n    ads_google_rows = []\n    promos_rows = []\n    weather_rows = []\n\n    for i in range(days):\n        day = today - timedelta(days=i)\n        date_str = day.strftime(\"%Y-%m-%d\")\n\n        temp_bonus = 0.0\n        rain_bonus = 0.0\n        multiplier = 1.0\n        for shock in shocks:\n            if shock.applies(i):\n                temp_bonus += shock.temp_delta\n                rain_bonus += shock.rain_mm\n                multiplier += shock.temp_delta * 0.02\n\n        orders_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"created_at\": f\"{date_str}T00:00:00Z\",\n            \"net_revenue\": float(120 + i * 4 + temp_bonus * 3),\n            \"ship_latitude\": geos[0][0],\n            \"ship_longitude\": geos[0][1],\n            \"ship_geohash\": geohash2.encode(geos[0][0], geos[0][1], 5),\n        })\n\n        ads_meta_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"date\": date_str,\n            \"channel\": \"meta\",\n            \"spend\": float((25 + i) * multiplier),\n            \"conversions\": float(2 + i * 0.1),\n        })\n\n        ads_google_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"date\": date_str,\n            \"channel\": \"google\",\n            \"spend\": float(18 + i * 0.6),\n            \"conversions\": float(1.2 + i * 0.07 * multiplier),\n        })\n\n        promos_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"send_date\": f\"{date_str}T12:00:00Z\",\n            \"campaign_id\": f\"promo-{i}\",\n            \"discount_pct\": float(10 if i % 3 == 0 else 0),\n        })\n\n        for lat, lon in geos:\n            gh = geohash2.encode(lat, lon, 5)\n            base_temp = 18 + i + lat * 0.05\n            base_precip = (i % 2) * 2\n            weather_rows.append({\n                \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n                \"date\": date_str,\n                \"geohash\": gh,\n                \"temp_c\": float(base_temp + temp_bonus),\n                \"precip_mm\": float(base_precip + rain_bonus),\n            })\n\n    weather_df = pl.DataFrame(weather_rows)\n    if not weather_df.is_empty():\n        weather_df = weather_df.with_columns([\n            (pl.col(\"temp_c\") - pl.col(\"temp_c\").mean().over(\"geohash\")).alias(\"temp_anomaly\"),\n            (pl.col(\"precip_mm\") - pl.col(\"precip_mm\").mean().over(\"geohash\")).alias(\"precip_anomaly\"),\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=1)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=1)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        ])\n        weather_rows = weather_df.to_dicts()\n\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\", orders_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_meta_ads\", ads_meta_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_google_ads\", ads_google_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_promos\", promos_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_weather_daily\", weather_rows)\n"
}

**Evaluating planning approach for T4.1.4**

Iâ€™m sorting out how to create a plan for implementing multi-horizon ensemble forecasting under the given constraints, debating whether to use an autop planning tool or produce a manual plan. Since escalation isnâ€™t allowed and the final response must be JSON, Iâ€™m leaning toward drafting the plan internally while considering integration steps like running scripts on synthetic data and tying into existing pipelines and experiments.

**Drafting plan for ensemble metrics**

Iâ€™m mapping out a plan to create and run code that captures ensemble metrics as JSON within experiments. Iâ€™ll explore generating or using synthetic data to test the multi-horizon ensemble, implement a runnable pipeline or CLI script to produce metrics files, and arrange to run critics after meaningful changes. Letâ€™s start by inspecting existing modules and searching for relevant calls to `multi_horizon`.

idx in range(days)]\n    temp_c = [10.0 + 0.5 * idx for idx in range(days)]\n    meta_spend = [100.0 + 5.0 * np.sin(idx / 4.0) for idx in range(days)]\n    revenue = [200.0 + 8.0 * idx + 0.75 * temp_c[idx] for idx in range(days)]\n    return {\n        \"date\": [value.isoformat() for value in dates],\n        \"temp_c\": temp_c,\n        \"temp_roll7\": temp_c,\n        \"precip_mm\": [0.25 * np.cos(idx / 5.0) for idx in range(days)],\n        \"meta_spend\": meta_spend,\n        \"net_revenue\": revenue,\n        \"target_available\": [True] * days,\n    }\n\n\ndef _build_weather_rows(horizon: int = 3) -> list[dict[str, float | str]]:\n    start = date(2024, 1, 31)\n    rows: list[dict[str, float | str]] = []\n    for offset in range(1, horizon + 1):\n        current = start + timedelta(days=offset)\n        rows.append(\n            {\n                \"date\": current.isoformat(),\n                \"temp_c\": 12.0 + offset,\n                \"temp_roll7\": 12.0 + offset,\n                \"precip_mm\": 0.5,\n                \"observation_type\": \"forecast\",\n            }\n        )\n    return rows\n\n\ndef test_run_multi_horizon_ensemble_produces_forecasts():\n    design_matrix = _build_design_matrix()\n    weather_rows = _build_weather_rows()\n    result = run_multi_horizon_ensemble(design_matrix, weather_rows, horizon_days=3, seed=123)\n\n    assert result.forecasts, \"Expected forecasts to be generated\"\n    assert len(result.forecasts) == 3\n\n    horizons = {point.horizon_days for point in point.quantiles[\"p10\"] <= point.quantiles[\"p50\"] <= point.quantiles[\"p90\"]\n\n    weights = result.metrics[\"component_weights\"]\n    assert abs(sum(weights.values()) - 1.0) < 1e-6\n    assert result.metrics[\"forecast_rows\"] == 3\n\n\ndef test_save_ensemble_metrics_as_json(tmp_path: Path):\n    design_matrix = _build_design_matrix()\n    weather_rows = _build_weather_rows()\n    result = run_multi_horizon_ensemble(design_matrix, weather_rows, horizon_days=2, seed=2024)\n\n    output_path = tmp_path / \"ensemble.json\"\n    save_ensemble_metrics_as_json(result, output_path)\n    assert output_path.exists()\n\n    payload = json.loads(output_path.read_text(encoding=\"utf-8\"))\n    assert \"forecasts\" in payload\n    assert \"metrics\" in payload\n    assert \"diagnostics\" in payload\n    assert len(payload[\"forecasts\"]) == 2\n"
}

  "content": "from __future__ import annotations\n\nimport argparse\nimport json\nimport math\nimport os\nimport pickle\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Tuple\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\nfrom loguru import logger\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, LinearGAM, evaluate_r2, fit_baseline_model\nfrom shared.feature_store.feature_builder import (\n    FeatureBuilder,\n    FeatureLeakageError,\n    FeatureMatrix,\n    TARGET_COLUMN,\n)\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Float64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt8,\n}\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass BaselineTrainingResult:\n    tenant_id: str\n    run_id: str\n    model: BaselineModel\n    model_path: Path\n    metadata_path: Path\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any]\n\n\ndef train_baseline(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start: datetime,\n    end: datetime,\n    *,\n    lake_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"),\n    output_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/models/baseline\"),\n    run_id: str | None = None,\n    feature_min_rows: int = 14,\n) -> BaselineTrainingResult:\n    \"\"\"Train and persist the weather-aware baseline model for a tenant.\"\"\"\n\n    builder = FeatureBuilder(lake_root=lake_root, feature_min_rows=feature_min_rows)\n    leakage_info: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"status\": \"clean\",\n        \"removed_rows\": 0,\n        \"forward_leakage_rows\": 0,\n        \"forecast_leakage_rows\": 0,\n        \"leakage_dates\": [],\n        \"forward_leakage_dates\": [],\n        \"forecast_leakage_dates\": [],\n    }\n\n    try:\n        matrix = builder.build(tenant_id, start, end)\n    except FeatureLeakageError as exc:\n        if exc.matrix is None:\n            raise\n        matrix = exc.matrix\n        leakage_info.update(\n            {\n                \"status\": \"sanitized\",\n                \"message\": str(exc),\n                \"removed_rows\": exc.leakage_rows,\n                \"forward_leakage_rows\": exc.forward_rows,\n                \"forecast_leakage_rows\": exc.forecast_rows,\n                \"leakage_dates\": exc.leakage_dates,\n                \"forward_leakage_dates\": exc.forward_dates,\n                \"forecast_leakage_dates\": exc.forecast_dates,\n            }\n        )\n\n    observed = _prepare_observed_frame(matrix)\n    if observed.is_empty():\n        raise ValueError(f\"No observed targets available for tenant={tenant_id}\")\n\n    features = _candidate_features(observed)\n\n    train_frame, holdout_frame = _split_train_holdout(observed)\n    model = fit_baseline_model(train_frame, target=TARGET_COLUMN, features=features)\n\n    train_metrics = _compute_metrics(model, train_frame, TARGET_COLUMN)\n    holdout_metrics = _compute_metrics(model, holdout_frame, TARGET_COLUMN)\n    influences = _rank_features(model, train_frame)\n\n    gam_min_rows = max(24, len(model.features) * 4) if model.features else 24\n    if model.gam is None:\n        if not model.features:\n            gam_reason = \"no_features\"\n        elif len(train_frame) + len(holdout_frame) < gam_min_rows:\n            gam_reason = \"insufficient_rows\"\n        elif LinearGAM is None:\n            gam_reason = \"pygam_unavailable\"\n        else:\n            gam_reason = \"fallback_linear\"\n    else:\n        gam_reason = \"gam\"\n\n    timestamp = datetime.utcnow().replace(microsecond=0).isoformat() + \"Z\"\n    resolved_run_id = run_id or datetime.utcnow().strftime(\"%Y%m%dT%H%M%SZ\")\n    output_dir = Path(output_root) / tenant_id / resolved_run_id\n    output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n    model_path = output_dir / \"baseline_model.pkl\"\n    with model_path.open(\"wb\") as fh:\n        pickle.dump(model, fh)\n\n    diagnostics_path = None\n    if not holdout_frame.is_empty():\n        diagnostics = holdout_frame.with_columns(\n            model.predict(holdout_frame).alias(\"prediction\")\n        )\n        diagnostics_path = output_dir / \"holdout_diagnostics.parquet\"\n        diagnostics.write_parquet(diagnostics_path, compression=\"zstd\")\n\n    metadata = {\n        \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n        \"run_id\": resolved_run_id,\n        \"timestamp_utc\": timestamp,\n        \"window\": {\"start\": start.isoformat(), \"end\": end.isoformat()},\n        \"data\": {\n            \"observed_rows\": int(observed.height),\n            \"train_rows\": int(train_frame.height),\n            \"holdout_rows\": int(holdout_frame.height),\n            \"feature_columns\": len(features),\n            \"orders_rows\": matrix.orders_rows,\n            \"ads_rows\": matrix.ads_rows,\n            \"promo_rows\": matrix.promo_rows,\n            \"weather_rows\": matrix.weather_rows,\n            \"latest_observed_target_date\": matrix.latest_observed_date,\n        },\n        \"features\": list(model.features),\n        \"top_features\": influences,\n        \"gam\": {\n            \"used\": model.gam is not None,\n            \"reason\": gam_reason,\n            \"min_required_rows\": gam_min_rows,\n        },\n        \"training\": train_metrics,\n        \"holdout\": holdout_metrics,\n        \"leakage_guardrail\": {\n            **leakage_info,\n            \"leakage_risk_rows\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows,\n            \"forward_leakage_rows_matrix\": matrix.forward_leakage_rows,\n            \"forecast_leakage_rows_matrix\": matrix.forecast_leakage_rows,\n        },\n        \"artifacts\": {\n            \"model_path\": str(model_path),\n            \"holdout_diagnostics\": str(diagnostics_path) if diagnostics_path else None,\n        },\n    }\n\n    metadata_path = output_dir / \"metadata.json\"\n    metadata_path.write_text(json.dumps(metadata, indent=2, sort_keys=True))\n\n    logger.info(\n        \"Baseline training complete for tenant=%s run=%s | rows=%d gam=%s r2=%.3f holdout_r2=%.3f\",\n        tenant_id,\n        resolved_run_id,\n        metadata[\"data\"][\"observed_rows\"],\n        metadata[\"gam\"][\"reason\"],\n        metadata[\"training\"][\"r2\"],\n        metadata[\"holdout\"][\"r2\"],\n    )\n\n    return BaselineTrainingResult(\n        tenant_id=tenant_id,\n        run_id=resolved_run_id,\n        model=model,\n        model_path=model_path,\n        metadata_path=metadata_path,\n        metadata=metadata,\n    )\n\n\ndef _prepare_observed_frame(matrix: FeatureMatrix) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    observed = matrix.observed_frame\n    drop_cols = [col for col in (\"target_available\", \"leakage_risk\", \"tenant_id\") if col in observed.columns]\n    if drop_cols:\n        observed = observed.drop(drop_cols)\n    return observed.sort(\"date\")\n\n\ndef _candidate_features(frame: pl.DataFrame) -> List[str]:\n    return [\n        column\n        for column, dtype in frame.schema.items()\n        if column != TARGET_COLUMN and dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    ]\n\n\ndef _split_train_holdout(frame: pl.DataFrame, holdout_min: int = 14, frac: float = 0.2) -> Tuple[pl.DataFrame, pl.DataFrame]:\n    total = frame.height\n    if total <= 2:\n        return frame, frame.clear()\n    holdout = max(int(total * frac), holdout_min if total > holdout_min else 1)\n    if holdout >= total:\n        holdout = max(1, total // 3)\n    train_rows = max(total - holdout, 1)\n    if train_rows == total:\n        return frame, frame.clear()\n    train_frame = frame.head(train_rows)\n    holdout_frame = frame.tail(total - train_rows)\n    return train_frame, holdout_frame\n\n\ndef _compute_metrics(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame, target: str) -> Dict[str, float]:\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return {\n            \"rows\": 0,\n            \"r2\": 0.0,\n            \"mae\": 0.0,\n            \"rmse\": 0.0,\n            \"bias\": 0.0,\n            \"mean_prediction\": 0.0,\n            \"std_prediction\": 0.0,\n        }\n    preds = model.predict(frame).to_numpy()\n    actuals = frame[target].to_numpy()\n    residuals = actuals - preds\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residuals)))\n    rmse = float(np.sqrt(np.mean(residuals ** 2)))\n    bias = float(np.mean(residuals))\n    mean_prediction = float(np.mean(preds))\n    std_prediction = float(np.std(preds))\n    r2 = evaluate_r2(model, frame)\n    rows = len(actuals)\n    return {\n        \"rows\": int(rows),\n        \"r2\": _clean_float(r2),\n        \"mae\": _clean_float(mae),\n        \"rmse\": _clean_float(rmse),\n        \"bias\": _clean_float(bias),\n        \"mean_prediction\": _clean_float(mean_prediction),\n        \"std_prediction\": _clean_float(std_prediction),\n    }\n\n\ndef _rank_features(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame, limit: int = 8) -> List[Dict[str, float]]:\n    if frame.is_empty() or not model.features:\n        return []\n\n    rankings: List[Tuple[str, float]] = []\n    if model.gam is None and model.coefficients:\n        for feature in model.features:\n            if feature not in model.coefficients or feature not in frame.columns:\n                continue\n            values = frame[feature].to_numpy()\n            if values.size == 0:\n                continue\n            std = float(np.std(values))\n            if not math.isfinite(std) or std == 0.0:\n                continue\n            influence = abs(model.coefficients[feature]) * std\n            rankings.append((feature, influence))\n    else:\n        preds = model.predict(frame).to_numpy()\n        for feature in model.features:\n            if feature not in frame.columns:\n                continue\n            values = frame[feature].to_numpy()\n            if values.size == 0:\n                continue\n            if np.allclose(values, values[0]):\n                continue\n            corr = np.corrcoef(values, preds)[0, 1]\n            if not np.isfinite(corr):\n                continue\n            rankings.append((feature, float(abs(corr))))\n\n    rankings.sort(key=lambda item: item[1], reverse=True)\n    top = rankings[:limit]\n    return [{\"feature\": name, \"influence\": _clean_float(score)} for name, score in top]\n\n\ndef _clean_float(value: float) -> float:\n    if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and math.isfinite(value):\n        return float(value)\n    return 0.0\n\n\ndef _parse_args(argv: Iterable[str] | None = None) -> argparse.Namespace:\n    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description=\"Train WeatherVane baseline (GAM) model\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"tenant\", help=\"Tenant identifier to train\")\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--start\",\n        type=_parse_date,\n        help=\"Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to end - lookback-days.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--end\",\n        type=_parse_date,\n        help=\"End date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today (UTC).\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--lookback-days\",\n        type=int,\n        default=365,\n        help=\"Window length when --start is omitted.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--lake-root\",\n        default=os.getenv(\"STORAGE_LAKE_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/raw\"),\n        help=\"Root directory for raw lake datasets.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--output-root\",\n        default=os.getenv(\"BASELINE_OUTPUT_ROOT\", \"storage/models/baseline\"),\n        help=\"Directory to store trained model artifacts.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--run-id\",\n        help=\"Optional run identifier (defaults to timestamp).\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--feature-min-rows\",\n        type=int,\n        default=14,\n        help=\"Minimum rows required before generating lag/rolling features.\",\n    )\n    return parser.parse_args(list(argv) if argv is not None else None)\n\n\ndef _parse_date(value: str) -> datetime:\n    return datetime.strptime(value, \"%Y-%m-%d\")\n\n\ndef train(argv: Iterable[str] | None = None) -> BaselineTrainingResult:\n    args = _parse_args(argv)\n    end = args.end or datetime.utcnow()\n    start = args.start or (end - timedelta(days=int(args.lookback_days)))\n    return train_baseline(\n        tenant_id=args.tenant,\n        start=start,\n        end=end,\n        lake_root=args.lake_root,\n        output_root=args.output_root,\n        run_id=args.run_id,\n        feature_min_rows=int(args.feature_min_rows),\n    )\n\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    train()\n"
}
